Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In 1987, Father Gabriele Amorth, the Pope's personal exorcist, an earthy, scooter-riding, humorous, practical man, visits an Italian village where a man is seemingly possessed by a demon.
2) With the local priest, Amorth enters the room where the man is tied up.
3) While exorcising him, using a Saint Benedict Medal sacramental, Amorth taunts the demon, challenging it to possess a pig; when it does, the pig is killed with a shotgun.
4) This incident gets Amorth in trouble with a Church tribunal, since he acted without permission from superiors.
5) One tribunal member is a friendly African Bishop, Lumumba, but another is a vicious American Cardinal, Sullivan, skeptical of demonic possession.
6) Amorth replies that evil does exist and that he did not perform an actual exorcism but rather, some psychological theater to help the mentally ill man.
7) Disgusted, Amorth walks out of the tribunal.
8) The Pope assigns Amorth to visit a possessed boy named Henry in Spain.
9) Henry, his mother Julia, and his rebellious teenage sister Amy had traveled from America to take possession of a mysterious old Spanish abbey, Julia's husband's sole bequest to his family after he died in a car accident where Henry was present.
10) The traumatized Henry has not spoken since the accident.
11) Following a sinister fire, workers who were restoring the abbey so the family could sell it, leave.
12) Henry starts behaving bizarrely, and supernatural events unfold; serum chemistry panels and MRI show nothing abnormal.
13) Diabolically possessed, Henry requests a priest; the local Father Tomas Esquibel arrives, but Henry obscenely derides him.
14) Amorth arrives and enlists Esquibel as an assistant, though Esquibel is untrained as an exorcist.
15) Esquibel has heard of Amorth but not read Amorth's books; Amorth believes they are good books.
16) Amorth advocates the importance of prayer, though Esquibel makes mistakes as an assistant exorcist, including strangling Henry when Henry antagonizes him, mocking him for his sins.
17) The duo attempt to exorcise Henry, without success, as he utters blasphemous phrases during the rite.
18) Henry's demon even possesses Amy at times.
19) Amorth finds Julia has not been a religious believer since childhood.
20) Still, he convinces her to pray after she reveals that she believed that her guardian angel helped her in her youth.
21) In Rome, the Pope becomes ill while reading documents about the Spanish case and is hospitalized.
22) Amorth finds a well on the abbey grounds going down to a complex sealed off by the Church as demonically dangerous.
23) He learns that a founder of the Spanish Inquisition, an exorcist, was possessed, which let him infiltrate the Church and do many evils.
24) Amorth also finds the Church covered this up and eventually discovers the name of Henry's demon, Asmodeus, which will assist the exorcism.
25) Amorth and Esquibel participate in the sacrament of Confession and Absolution, mutually confessing and absolving each other of their sins: that after Amorth, an Italian partisan, survived World War II and vowed to serve God in gratitude, a mentally ill woman asked for Amorth's help, and died by suicide when he did not help her due to pride; and Esquibel fornicated with a young woman he did not later marry.
26) The two ready themselves; Amorth instructs Esquibel to wear a Miraculous Medal necklace.
27) During the exorcism, they have horrible visions of the women whom they failed.
28) The exorcism succeeds only when Amorth offers himself to be possessed, which chimes with Asmodeus's previously stating that he wants to destroy Amorth.
29) Amorth tries to hang himself, but the demon doesn't allow it, preferring that Amorth infiltrate and destroy the Church.
30) However, Esquibel helps Amorth drive away the demon and demonic appearances resembling the two women who troubled the men, successfully banishing Asmodeus back to Hell.
31) The Pope does recover, as does Henry while the Vatican purchases and reconsecrates the abbey.
32) The triumphant duo visit Rome and find Sullivan has taken leave in Guam, being replaced by Lumumba.
33) Amorth and Esquibel are admitted to a special Church archive; Lumumba tells them they will be visiting 199 other evil sites, with the help of a map Amorth discovered at the abbey, to combat the Devil; Amorth jokes that he and Esquibel are going to Hell.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Elena, a devoted mechanic, is seen in the confines of a small, shadowy garage in the heartland of Milwaukee.
2) Her mechanical know-how, an invaluable hand-me-down from her father, shines through her dexterous maneuvers around the car's spidery innards.
3) One evening, her routine is disrupted by the ring of her trusty landline phone.
4) On the other end is Gabriela, her old friend from childhood, who left the familiar monotony of their humble upbringing for a world of extravagant displays and indulgence in Los Angeles.
5) Gabriela entices Elena with an elegant invitation to an exclusive party at her swanky mansion.
6) Elena, ensnared in her uncomplicated existence that appears colorless compared to Gabriela’s opulent kaleidoscope, feels hesitant.
7) However, the prospect of breaking free from the monotonous familiarity of her day-to-day life gives her the nudge she needed.
8) The crowd circles around her with an air of elitist indifference, their curt nods and feigned handshakes interrupted by dismissive brush-offs.
9) Abruptly, the festivities are interrupted as ominous black clouds roll in – a vicious hurricane that wasn't on any forecast strikes without warning, casting the mansion into a state of chaos.
10) Disturbed and suspicious, Elena finds herself surreptitiously moving through the cavernous corridors and rooms of the mansion, trying to decipher the cause behind the unsettling energy humming through the crowd.
11) Elena stumbles down a hidden staircase to a secret chamber beneath the mansion.
12) Moving along the chamber with wary steps, she discovers odd symbols etched in the stone walls and disturbing newspaper clippings detailing several unresolved disappearances during past hurricanes.
13) Connecting the terrifying dots, Elena is seized with an icy dread- the hurricane, previous disappearances, the meeting of the guests during this catastrophic event - all seem intricately linked.
14) Burdened with trepidation, she races back to warn Gabriela of the danger they may be surrounded by.
15) Gabriela, intoxicated by the glitz and glamour, dismisses Elena's warnings as unfounded paranoia.
16) As the hurricane reaches its peak savagery, the distinguished guests shed their amiable veneers.
17) They reveal themselves to be acolytes of an ancient cult that worships the destructive power of storms.
18) The cult members confess to harnessing the immense power of hurricanes for an occult ritual.
19) The aim - to cheat death and gain eternal life.
20) Elena's blood turns to ice as realization grips her - Gabriela is the carefully planned offering required to guarantee the cult's longevity goals.
21) Overcome with fear yet resolved to protect her friend, Elena resolves to thwart the cultists' wicked scheme.
22) Relying on her in-depth mechanical knowledge accrued over years spent in her garage sanctuary, Elena prepares to engage in a perilous confrontation with the menacing cult members.
23) Benefiting from her earlier exploration of the mansion, Elena locates Gabriela at the ceremonial heart of the cult ritual.
24) Barely scraping through, they manage to escape from the mansion just as the hurricane begins to ease.
25) Drenched to the bone and buffeted by the relenting winds, they stumble upon a local police station in the small neighboring town of Goleta.
26) Shaken to their core, they relay their petrifying encounters to the incredulous local police.
27) After initial skepticism, the police decide to investigate the claims and head to the mansion.
28) Stubbornly trudging back to normalcy, both Elena and Gabriela find comfort in the shared past and the horrifying ordeal they narrowly escaped.
29) Elena discovers her hidden bravery, taking pride in saving Gabriela from the clutches of the heinous cult.
30) Gabriela, having had a close brush with death, looks at her friend with newfound respect and gratitude, acknowledging Elena's exceptional bravery.
31) Forced by their near-death experience, the duo continues their lives, holding their deep friendship close to their hearts.
32) Gabriela learns to appreciate Elena's quiet, industrious life, while Elena finds respect for Gabriela's undeniable zest.
33) Nonetheless, the memory of their frightful night lingers like a morose shadow, ominously coloring their lives.
34) As the curtains close on this chapter, the camera glides to an ominous still.
35) The lens focuses on a grand mansion, eerily similar to Gabriela's, basking under the menacing storm clouds in the French milieu – Mansion de la Lune.
36) As darkness descends, the mansion's windows inexplicably glow, suggesting an unending reign of terror.

32) Caleb sets fire to the money and they escape, leaving Mr. Big to burn.

instruction: Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In a dystopian 2050, fighter pilot Adam Reed steals a time jet to escape to 2018 to save his wife, Laura.
2) In the process, he gets injured and crash-lands in 2022.
3) Following the death of his father Louis a year previously, a 12-year-old Adam is bullied at school, gets suspended for fighting, and is distant from his mother Ellie.
4) When he is home alone one night, he finds the injured future Adam.
5) The younger Adam refuses to trust the stranger, but future Adam inadvertently mentions the names of both the younger Adam and his dog, Hawking.
6) The younger Adam soon realizes that the stranger in front of him is his future self.
7) Due to a safety feature preventing him from flying because of his injuries, Adam must bring along the younger Adam and use his DNA to enter his jet.
8) They both are soon attacked by Maya Sorian, the leader of the dystopian world, and her assistant Christos, but are saved by Laura, who had faked her death and stayed off-grid in an unknown location.
9) After surviving the attack and comparing notes, Laura and the Adams realize that after the invention of time travel by Louis and his subsequent death, Sorian had monopolized the discovery.
10) During her visit to 2018, Laura learned Sorian frequently came and advised her past self in order to secure her future wealth and power.
11) To protect her secret, Sorian ordered Laura's death.
12) Although Laura survived the assassination attempt, destruction of her time jet left her stranded in the past.
13) The sudden arrival of Sorian's goons interrupts the reunion, and Laura fights off the attack long enough for the two Adams to escape to 2018.
14) In 2018, the Adams meet Louis in an attempt to enlist his help, but their father refuses any assistance out of concern for the effect on the time stream.
15) That night, Sorian meets and warns her past self about Adam.
16) Meanwhile, the Adams share their common feelings about their father in a motel.
17) The next day, they both set off to destroy the time travel machine.
18) On arrival at Sorian Technologies, they are attacked by Sorian's soldiers, but are unexpectedly saved by Louis, who has changed his mind and agrees to guide them.
19) He reveals that destroying the machine will not destroy time travel as long as Sorian has his algorithm with all the math and constraints to control the process.
20) Meanwhile, 2050 Sorian captures the younger Adam.
21) Although Louis and 2050 Adam remove a memory unit with the algorithm, both Sorians arrive and threaten 2022 Adam as leverage to coerce Louis into surrendering the algorithm.
22) 2050 Adam stalls, allowing 2022 Adam to escape from Sorian by pushing her gun away, but an errant bullet damages the seal restraining the electromagnetic field, causing it to grow to limitless values.
23) The Reeds try as much as they can to stop them, but the older Sorian threatens to kill Louis.
24) Adam warns that her bullets are armor-piercing, but Louis remains adamant.
25) Seeing no other way, Sorian shoots at Louis, but the path of the bullet is altered by the electromagnetic field and hits 2018 Sorian instead, killing her and therefore wiping 2050 Sorian out of existence.
26) The Reeds barely manage to escape the facility's implosion and reach home, where they reconcile by playing a game of catch before the Adams fade out and return to their respective times.
27) In 2022, the younger Adam lives in a new timeline where he never got suspended, has let go of his anger, and gives his mother a hug via an "echo".
28) Sometime in the future, an older and much happier Adam meets Laura during a flight training lecture where she realizes, to Adam's amusement, she has entered the wrong building on the campus.
29) Adam offers to walk her to her building, stating that he has got time, and they depart together.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 5.5 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 9.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 18.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 21.5 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 25.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").
output:
### 1. Identify the protagonist in the story
The protagonist of the story is Adam Reed, who is the main character and drives the plot forward. The story focuses on his journey through time and his efforts to save his wife and prevent a dystopian future.

### 2. At the sentence indicated by the first turning point, state the sentence again, and describe the protagonist's state.
The first turning point is at sentence 5.5, which we can approximate as sentence 5 or 6 since we don't have a 5.5 sentence. Let's use sentence 5 for analysis:
5) The younger Adam refuses to trust the stranger, but future Adam inadvertently mentions the names of both the younger Adam and his dog, Hawking.
At this point, the protagonist (future Adam) is injured and has crash-landed in 2022, but he has just found a way to potentially gain the trust of his younger self, which is a crucial step in his mission. The protagonist's condition can be approximated as a 4 out of 10, considering he is injured and faces significant challenges, but has also found a potential ally in his younger self.

### 3. Identify the second turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the first turning point.
The second turning point is at sentence 9.0:
9) After surviving the attack and comparing notes, Laura and the Adams realize that after the invention of time travel by Louis and his subsequent death, Sorian had monopolized the discovery.
At this point, the protagonist has survived an attack, been reunited with his wife (who he thought was dead), and has gained more information about the antagonist's plans. This represents a significant improvement in his condition, as he now has more allies and knowledge to aid in his mission. The protagonist's condition can be approximated as a 7 out of 10, reflecting the positive turn of events.

### 4. Identify the third turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the second turning point.
The third turning point is at sentence 18.0:
18) On arrival at Sorian Technologies, they are attacked by Sorian's soldiers, but are unexpectedly saved by Louis, who has changed his mind and agrees to guide them.
At this point, despite being attacked, the protagonist and his allies are saved by Louis, which is a turning point in their favor. This indicates that the protagonist has managed to secure the help of his father, a crucial ally. However, the fact that they were attacked suggests that the protagonist's condition is still precarious. The protagonist's condition can be approximated as an 8 out of 10, considering the positive development of gaining Louis's help but also facing significant danger.

### 5. Identify the fourth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the third turning point.
The fourth turning point is at sentence 21.5, which we can approximate as sentence 21 or 22. Let's use sentence 21 for analysis:
21) Meanwhile, 2050 Sorian captures the younger Adam.
At this point, the protagonist faces a significant setback as the younger Adam is captured by the antagonist. This represents a worsening of the protagonist's condition, as he now has to worry about the safety of his younger self in addition to his other challenges. The protagonist's condition can be approximated as a 5 out of 10, reflecting the capture of the younger Adam and the increased danger.

### 6. Identify the fifth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the fourth turning point.
The fifth turning point is at sentence 25.0:
25) Seeing no other way, Sorian shoots at Louis, but the path of the bullet is altered by the electromagnetic field and hits 2018 Sorian instead, killing her and therefore wiping 2050 Sorian out of existence.
At this point, the protagonist achieves a major victory as the antagonist is eliminated, and the dystopian future is potentially prevented. This represents a significant improvement in the protagonist's condition, as his mission is essentially accomplished, and he can look forward to a better future. The protagonist's condition can be approximated as a 9 out of 10, considering the success of his mission and the elimination of the main threat.

### 7. List the protagonist's condition at each turning point
Based on the analysis, the list of the protagonist's condition at each turning point is:
- First turning point: 4
- Second turning point: 7
- Third turning point: 8
- Fourth turning point: 5
- Fifth turning point: 9

### 8. Classify the story arc type based on the protagonist's condition list and explain your reasoning
The story arc type can be classified as a "Man in a Hole" because the protagonist starts in a difficult situation (injured and facing significant challenges), improves his condition as he gains allies and knowledge, faces a setback when the younger Adam is captured, but ultimately ends in a much better situation than where he started (having prevented the dystopian future and reunited with his wife). The protagonist's condition improves from the first turning point to the last, with fluctuations in between, which is characteristic of the "Man in a Hole" story arc.

### 9. Determine the story arc type
Man in a Hole

input:
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In 1165, the witcher Vesemir saves a noble child from a leshen in a forest in Kaedwen.
2) Before dying, the creature says something in an archaic elven dialect to Vesemir, leading him to think it was under someone's control.
3) Vesemir is visited by the elf Filavandrel, who thinks the leshen was controlled by Kitsu, one of many elven girls who have gone missing.
4) Meanwhile sorceress  Tetra Gilcrest tries to convince the Kaedwani king to wipe out the witchers, but Lady Zerbst, another courtier, is sympathetic to the witchers and speaks in their favor.
5) Vesemir reminisces about his youth when he, along with his best friend Illyana, were servants for a noble whose mistress was saved from a mahr by a witcher named Deglan with Vesemir's help.
6) Enticed by promises of coin and riches, Vesemir traveled to Kaer Morhen and underwent the training and mutations to become a witcher.
7) In the present day, Vesemir and another fellow witcher, Luka, are arrested for killing two knights in a bar fight.
8) Lady Zerbst persuades the king to send Vesemir along with Tetra to rid the forest of Kitsu.
9) She personally delivers the mission order to Vesemir who recognizes her as the now 70-year old Illyana.
10) Vesemir and Tetra set out and she tells him the story of a young sorceress wrongfully killed by a witcher as part of a con, and that she is convinced that all witchers are corrupted.
11) They find Kitsu, mutated and now able to cast powerful illusions, and fight her basilisk.
12) They kill the monster, but Kitsu escapes.
13) Following Kitsu, the pair come across an old and abandoned elven school where they find the bodies of the other missing female elves.
14) They rescue the captured Filavandrel, who explains that Kitsu tried to replicate the experiments that were done on her, and they come to the conclusion that witchers were responsible, creating new monsters to keep them in business.
15) Vesemir surmises that the monsters he encountered were probably created in Kaer Morhen and leaves to confront Deglan.
16) As he departs, Tetra destroys Kitsu's den, finds Kitsu later surveying the destruction, and blames the witchers.
17) Back at court, she likewise tells the king of the witchers' responsibility in the recent monsters attacks and is given authorization to lay siege to Kaer Morhen.
18) The King has Luka wrongly executed despite Lady Zerbst's protests.
19) She then escapes to warn the witchers.
20) Deglan admits to Vesemir to creating the monsters, including Kitsu, to protect their way of life and are alerted by Illyana of Tetra's assault.
21) Tetra and the local townsfolk attack Kaer Morhen with Kitsu and her monsters.
22) Illyana helps the witcher recruits flee into the mountains.
23) Vesemir confronts Tetra, who has captured the mages and is holding them hostage in the basement.
24) Kitsu arrives and plunges Vesemir into an illusion where he married Illyana and had a family.
25) However, Vesemir is able to break out of the illusion and engages in a fierce battle with Tetra and her forces.
26) He seemingly kills Tetra and Kitsu, only for it to be revealed as another illusion.
27) He had instead mortally wounded Illyana and killed the mages, meaning that the art of creating more witchers died with them.
28) Tetra reveals she is the daughter of the sorceress killed by the swindling witcher from her story before being killed by a dying Deglan.
29) He asks Vesemir to find the recruits and make them into "better men" before succumbing to his wounds.
30) At the behest of Illyana, Vesemir allows Kitsu to flee, and he carries a dying Illyana from the burning castle.
31) Vesemir takes Illyana to a lake, where she always dreamed of living by.
32) The two share a brief moment before she peacefully passes away.
33) He then sets out and catches up to the recruits, including a young Geralt, taking them under his wing as the last batch of witchers.

- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)

The protagonist in the story is Vesemir, a witcher.

### 2. First Turning Point (Opportunity)
The sentence corresponding to the first turning point (Opportunity) is:
5) Vesemir reminisces about his youth when he, along with his best friend Illyana, were servants for a noble whose mistress was saved from a mahr by a witcher named Deglan with Vesemir's help.

At this point, Vesemir's state is one of reminiscence and reflection on his past, indicating a sense of stability and possibly a slight disconnection from his current mission or concerns. His condition can be approximated as a 5 out of 10, as he is not in immediate danger but also not actively pursuing a goal that significantly improves his situation.

### 3. Second Turning Point (Change of Plans)
The sentence corresponding to the second turning point (Change of Plans) is:

Relative to the first turning point, Vesemir's situation has changed in that he now has a clear mission and direction. This change indicates a slight improvement in his condition, as he is now actively engaged in a task that could lead to resolution or improvement. His condition can be approximated as a 6 out of 10, reflecting the potential for positive change through his actions.

### 4. Third Turning Point (Point of No Return)
The sentence corresponding to the third turning point (Point of No Return) is:
16) As he departs, Tetra destroys Kitsu's den, finds Kitsu later surveying the destruction, and blames the witchers.

At this point, Vesemir has decided to confront Deglan about the creation of monsters, indicating a commitment to uncovering the truth and potentially righting the wrongs within the witcher community. However, Tetra's actions and beliefs about witchers have also become more entrenched, setting the stage for conflict. Vesemir's condition might seem to slightly deteriorate due to the escalating conflict and his personal stake in the witcher community's reputation, approximating his condition as a 5 out of 10.

### 5. Fourth Turning Point (Major Setback)
The sentence corresponding to the fourth turning point (Major Setback) is:
21) Tetra and the local townsfolk attack Kaer Morhen with Kitsu and her monsters.

This event marks a significant setback for Vesemir, as the attack on Kaer Morhen represents a direct threat to the witcher community and everything he holds dear. His condition worsens significantly, as he faces loss and danger on multiple fronts. His condition can be approximated as a 2 out of 10, reflecting the dire circumstances and personal losses he is about to face.

### 6. Fifth Turning Point (Climax)
The sentence corresponding to the fifth turning point (Climax) is:
30) At the behest of Illyana, Vesemir allows Kitsu to flee, and he carries a dying Illyana from the burning castle.

At this point, Vesemir has faced immense personal and professional loss, including the death of Illyana and the destruction of Kaer Morhen. However, he also finds a moment of peace and closure with Illyana, and he begins to see a path forward, particularly in his decision to take the young recruits under his wing. Despite the tragedy, there is a sense of resolution and a new beginning. His condition, while still sorrowful, can be seen as improving slightly from the absolute low of the previous turning point, approximating his condition as a 4 out of 10.

### 7. Protagonist's Condition List

- First turning point (Opportunity): 5
- Second turning point (Change of Plans): 6
- Third turning point (Point of No Return): 5
- Fourth turning point (Major Setback): 2
- Fifth turning point (Climax): 4

### 8. Classify the Story Arc Type
The story arc type can be classified based on the pattern of the protagonist's condition. Given that Vesemir starts in a neutral state, improves slightly, then faces significant challenges and setbacks before ending in a state that, while still difficult, shows a path towards recovery and a new beginning, the story fits the "Man in a Hole" arc. This arc is characterized by the protagonist falling into a dilemma and then finding a way out, often ending in a better state than when they started, or at least with a hopeful outlook for the future.

### 9. Determined Story Arc Type
Man in a Hole

instruction: Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Raquel starts narrating the story of her life.
2) In a classroom we see her refusing to read her assignment as even though she knows how to write a story, she isn’t brave enough to tell it.
3) She then says that her story doesn’t start in this classroom, it actually starts in her house.
4) Her house as she describes is a humble abode that, through ups and downs, ended up surrounded by an empire called the Hidalgo mansion.
5) The Hidalgos are her next door neighbors but their lifestyle is completely different from hers.
6) The Hidalgos own Alpha 3, one of the most influential companies in the country, whose headquarters is the most spectacular building in Barcelona.
7) Alpha 3 refers to the three heirs to the empire, the Hidalgo brothers, Artemis, Ares and Apolo.
8) Raquel has an unhealthy obsession with Ares but has never said a word to him.
9) She knows everything he does and likes to collect information about him.
10) Apolo thanks Raquel for letting them use her Wi-Fi as theirs is broken.
11) She is confused and finds out that Ares has hacked into her computer and cracked the Wi-Fi password.
12) The next day Raquel follows Ares into a secluded wooded area, where she confronts him about hacking into her computer.
13) In response, he writes the password on her hand and asks her why it is a code that says, ‘Ares, Greek God’.
14) They exchange words which leads to Raquel admitting that she likes him and wants him to fall for her.
15) At night she unplugs the Wi-Fi to assert that it's her, who is in control of it.
16) But Ares climbs up her window into her room and plugs it back in.
17) They share a steamy moment that leaves Raquel wanting for more.
18) The next day Ares invites her to a party where she seduces him but doesn’t let him get what he wants and exclaims that karma is a bitch.
19) Later, she buys a drink for Apolo who gets too drunk and doesn’t want to go back to his place.
20) She takes him to her place with the help of her friend, Daniela.
21) On the way to her place, Apolo accidentally breaks her phone.
22) Ares again climbs up her window and says that until their father goes to work, they can’t go back home.
23) Ares opens up to her about his grandfather’s death and how he too has allergies just like him.
24) Ares gifts Raquel a new phone but she isn’t very pleased with this gesture.
25) So she goes to his house to return the phone but things get too steamy and they end up having sex.
26) But after this, Ares acts indifferent which makes Raquel really angry and she storms off.
27) She realizes that she has left her locket at his place so she goes back to get it.
28) She ends up staying the night but in the morning he again dismisses her and makes her leave.
29) Raquel’s friends, Daniela and Yoshi bring her to a party to help her take her mind off of Ares where she gets drunk.
30) Ares sees her in the street in a vulnerable position and takes her to her house.
31) Ares admits that he has been pushing her away as she makes him feel things and how his father has already set a path for him which he has follow.
32) A path that doesn’t involve falling for any girl.
33) Ares tells Raquel that he genuinely does care about her and asks her to give him another chance.
34) Everything seems to be going well this time.
35) But that is until Ares takes Raquel to a family party to prove a point to his father.
36) There, Raquel feels humiliated when she sees her mother working as a waiter.
37) Raquel has a heartfelt conversation with her mother where she tells her not to follow in the footsteps of her father.
38) Her father was a great writer but he never had the courage to publish his novel.
39) She encourages her to cut all the drama and just tell Ares how she really feels about him.
40) Raquel goes to Ares’s place to tell him just that but isn’t allowed into the house as everyone in his family feels that she is a distraction that will stop him from attaining his goals.
41) Ares disobeys everyone and runs to the prom where he is shunned by Yoshi for breaking Raquel’s heart so many times.
42) Yoshi is furious and doesn’t let Ares speak to Raquel.
43) They exchange words that lead to a fight where Yoshi pushes Ares into a partially empty pool, spilling chlorine into as he turns away.
44) Raquel visits him at the hospital and stays by his side the whole time until he completely recovers.
45) After the scare, Ares’s family lets him do what he wants.
46) So, he decided to study medicine in Stockholm.
47) At the airport, Ares confesses that he had purposefully broken their Wi-Fi so that he could talk to her.
48) Raquel is finally brave enough to tell her story, so four months later she publishes her book called ‘Through My Window’.
49) The end credits roll as we see Ares climb up her window to surprise her.

The protagonist in the story is Raquel.

### 2. At the sentence indicated by the first turning point, state the sentence again, and describe the protagonist's state.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Our cinematic journey begins with an expansive panorama of the city of Kolkata, India.
2) Among these slums, lives our boy-hero, Aadi.
3) Trapped in the labyrinth of the city's streets and bustling marketplaces, we encounter Aadi, an eager young boy of humble birth.
4) From the earliest light of dawn, Aadi embarks on his daily routine of scavenging through mounds of refuse.
5) His clothes, little more than tatters barely covering his thin frame, his feet bare and dirt-coated from walking on grimy city pavements, fail to suppress his passion for learning.
6) Every street corner, every alley, becomes a classroom in Aadi's inspiring vision of his city.
7) His already sparked interest blazes further when the local radio broadcasts a trivia contest, fashioned after the global phenomenon, 'Who Wants to Be a Millionaire.'
8) The chance to participate in such a contest pricks his imagination and Aadi begins to fantasize about the potential of showcasing his knowledge and hopefully transform his own reality from his stringent existence to something more promising.
9) In his solitary preparation for the big quiz, Aadi's mind wanders into the corridors of his painful past — the early demise of his parents, his relentless pursuit of his education in an environment devoid of the bare minimum.
10) The contest day finally arrives and we find Aadi, our champion-in-making, cozied up on the trivia's hot seat, face an embodiment of pure fear mixed with stark excitement.
11) As the contest kicks off, each right answer from Aadi steadily amasses increasing awe from the engaging audience and his contemptuous competitors.
12) The nail-biting suspense climbs higher and higher as Aadi sturdily moves to the final rounds, asserting his dominance and resilience in the competition.
13) A riveting plot twist occurs when the quiz host, out of the blue, brings forth an accusation against Aadi of rigging the game just before the final life-changing question.
14) Amidst overwhelming objections and in spite of Aadi's earnest protest, he is abruptly ousted from the show, a cloud of disgrace hanging over his dreams.
15) Dejected and heartbroken, Aadi finds solace in Nilam, another fellow scholar living in the same underprivileged circumstances, yet refusing to bend to them.
16) In a heartfelt and intense dialogue, Aadi shares with Nilam his crushed ambitions, but reasserts his unbroken resolve to uncover the truth and prove his innocence.
17) Touched by his unyielding spirit, Nilam pledges her support and promises to aid him on this challenging path.
18) Their struggle unfolds in an invigorating sequence where both Aadi and Nilam meticulously scour the city and libraries for each trivia question and its corresponding answer.
19) Gradually, they realize a startling revelation - Aadi's answers matched accuracy with the obscure episodes of his own life.
20) An astonishing realization evolves: Aadi did not cheat; the experiences of his life, gleaned from various unnoticed sources, simply prepared him to answer the contest's questions correctly.
21) Gathering their meticulously collated evidence, Aadi and Nilam make their case public and challenge the earlier accusation in a high-tension legal debate.
22) Astonished, the audiences watch as their extensive evidence successfully unveils the host's concealed intentions.
23) Recognizing Aadi's earnestness, the general public starts fervently rallying for him, demanding justice for the slandered boy.
24) Silenced watchers transform into vehement protestors, their dissent against the injustice growing louder and unyielding.
25) Consequently, Aadi is warmly reinstated to the trivia show amidst pulsating applause, assuring him a second chance to fair victory.
26) A renewed and confident Aadi courageously answers the final question correctly, scripting an unprecedented victory in the history of the quiz.
27) His victory spawns uncontained joy among friends, neighbors, and even strangers, bringing everyone into unison to celebrate his success.
28) Epilogue sees the establishment of a learning center, financed from the prize money Aadi won at the trivia show.
29) The newly erected learning center, rooted in Aadi’s aspirations, stands firm amidst Kolkata’s desolate poverty, radiating hope.
30) The narrative concludes with a shot of Aadi’s serene countenance, triumphantly signifying the transformative power of knowledge and the indomitable spirit of human tenacity.

- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)

- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:

- Point of No Return (tp3): 18.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 14.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.

7) Meanwhile, Dr. Hauser, a Nazi doctor that was a former colleague of Hess, is continuing the Deathcorp Project at a hideout in California and is performing experiments on innocent victims.
8) His project is funded by an American district attorney, James D. Madison, who has betrayed America and had sided with the Nazis.
9) Madison also has top secret files from the government which have scans of the Scroll of Osiris, as well as photos and information about Toulon's puppets.
10) Blade manages to have enough energy to sneak out into the night to participate in his own solo Nazi hunting and he hides out at a factory under a sheet and Officer Bruce, a corrupt American police officer is also there and stealing supplies for the Nazis.
11) Bruce hears Blade's footsteps and discovers him under the sheet and calls him Pinocchio before hitting him across the room with his baton.
12) Bruce picks up Blade to hit him again but Blade uses his eye spikes to impale Bruce's hand, which causes him to smack Blade against a wall, which only causes the spikes to go in further.
13) Blade manages to break free and musters enough strength to impales Bruce's ankle with his hook and drag him across the room and then finishes him off by sawing his head off violently with his knife.
14) During this time Elisa is at home dreaming of these events as they play out and she feels a jolt of power every time Blade's knife is used, which reveals a psychic link between the two.
15) Later on Gloria Vasquez, a Spanish nationalist spy and her henchman break into Elisa's apartment and tare the place apart looking for Blade and the scroll of Osiris.
16) They manage to find the scroll hidden behind a painting and then she uses a special chemical to put press photographer Barney Barnes to sleep and take him back to be experimented on by Hauser.
17) During this time Blade was observing the events from a closet, before moving to the window where he had hung on by the tip of his hook, he then jumped down many stories and landed on the ground without any sign of injury and followed Gloria to Hauser's secret hideout.
18) Meanwhile, Madison used a smoke bomb at the Daily Herald to knock Elisa and detective Joe Gray unconscious and also take them back to the hideout and Blade was already there and hiding behind a shelf.
19) Joe is chained up on the ceiling and his leg is broken with a wrench and Elisa is strapped to a torture device and repeatedly electrocuted and asked to hand over the translation of the scroll of Osiris, as Hauser was unable to do it himself as he did not understand Russian, Greek and Egyptian symbols, he also reveals that he plans to uses a giant Death Ray on the roof to shoot out a signal which will kill half the population of California and then revive them as murderous zombies that will follow orders from the Nazi regime.
20) Elisa refuses and is continued to be electrocuted with the torture device but she uses her psychic bio-energy to shut the machine down.
21) After this Blade cuts Joe down from his chain and systematically goes on a killing spree across the hideout and he begins by putting his hook into the mouth of one of the henchman and cutting him in the back of the head and slitting his throat.
22) He then is fired at by Lang's gun but each bullet misses and Blade finishes him off with a few stabs to the throat.
23) Hauser then uses his machine to transform Barney into a zombie slave to go after Blade, but he attacks Gloria instead, biting her and leaving her for dead and then Blade stabs her in the throat before putting Barney out his misery by cutting his leg and then sticking his knife through the back of his head and out the front of his mouth.
24) Blade then kills the Nazi that is operating the torture machine by slitting his throat and then runs full speed at Hauser.
25) Hauser manages to grab Blade with his mechanical hand and then puts him into a scorching hot furnace.
26) Elisa is stunned on the floor as she is experiencing Blade's pain and then Hauser wants to prove that the puppets can be destroyed, despite them being magical, by hitting Blade over and over with a sledgehammer.
27) Elisa is also feels every strike of pain through her strong psychic connection with Blade and Hauser eventually smashes Blade's head to pieces, which causes his entire body to combust into ash.
28) Hauser is proud to have defeated Blade but also disappointed he could not keep the knife as a souvenir and then Hauser accidentally breathes in the bio-energy that emits from Blade's corpse, which causes Blade to be fully reborn within Hauser's belly and he kills Hauser by chopping his way out.
29) For a few moments Blade's facial form has changed to display his eyes in an evil frown but after putting his hat on, the face changes back to his regular face and all of Hauser's blood mysterious vanishes.
30) This attack on Hauser was unfinished business between Blade in his human life and his former colleague.
31) After Hauser died, his 'dead-man's switch' on his mechanical hand had been set off which meant that the Death Ray was going to shoot out its signal, so Joe hands Blade a wrench and he climbs inside of the machine and breaks the inside.
32) This causes the ray and the hideout to explode and Blade, Elisa and Joe manage to escape unharmed.
33) After this Elisa prints a story about a killer puppet foiling a Nazi death plot in her newspaper article and because the Daily Herald is known for printing fictitious tabloid headlines then it is not believed by the public.
34) After this Joe uses Blade to climb through the vent in Madison's office and unlock the door.
35) When Madison arrives he is ambushed by Blade and he is killed by having his throat slit and so that his corpse would look like he had committed suicide.
36) After this Joe sets out with Blade on a mission to track down more double crossing Americans that are assisting the Nazis.

input:
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The narrative introduced Max, who had once lived a life full of zest and danger as an intrepid explorer, trading challenging adventures for fame.
2) Now well-known as an environmental celebrity, Max graced the stages of countless conferences as a keynote speaker, disseminating the importance of wildlife conservation.
3) Over time, Max started to feel a growing sense of detachment, the adrenalin of the past trickling away, replaced by an overpowering yearning for his old life laden with exhilarating quests and groundbreaking discoveries.
4) His mundane routine was suddenly interrupted when he received an extraordinary proposition from Dmitry Blackwood.
5) Blackwood, a prominent member of the Abyss Exploration Initiative, introduced an ambitious plan.
6) With a spark in his eyes, Blackwood shared his daring dream to plunge into the depths of the Mariana Trench.
7) The trench, well-known for its depth, was long suspected to house gigantic prehistoric megalodons, a fact that made Max's heart race with excitement.
8) Max was initially hesitant, considering the enormous risks involved.
9) Nonetheless, his inherited yearn for fresh adventures and penchant for uncharted territories guided him towards what was seemingly an audacious journey.
10) He arrived at Poseidon, an impressive floating marine research facility set to serve as the central hub for the upcoming thrilling voyage, teeming with anticipation.
11) Amid the team of seasoned scientific personnel, he came across Dr. Zoe Harper, a dedicated marine biologist driven by an unwavering dedication to preserve marine life.
12) This diverse group of expert researchers was the crème de la crème in their respective fields.
13) Max's ideologies clashed with Zoe's, their shared commitment to marine preservation sparking numerous lively debates.
14) The tension between them burgeoned into a dynamic, passionate relationship.
15) The team underwent an extensive training period, equipping themselves physically and mentally for the trials they were about to face.
16) They meticulously checked and double-checked all equipment, finally securing themselves inside the Nautilus, a revolutionary submarine designed specially for the extremities of deep-sea travel.
17) Integrating Max's expert navigational knowledge, the team began their astounding descent into the ominous and unsettling depths, where adventure awaited.
18) As they descended into the heart of the ocean, they were left awe-struck by the enchanting bioluminescence of the deep-sea organisms, their eyes gleaming with wonder as they navigated this glowing, underwater realm.
19) The further down they journeyed, the stranger the creatures they encountered.
20) Gigantic prehistoric plants coupled with ancient, previously unseen marine life set a breathtaking spectacle, effectively reigniting Max's latent love for exploration.
21) In the midst of their initial jubilation, the team was jolted back to reality when an enormous megalodon raced towards the Nautilus, its jaws snapping as it hit the vessel with a thunderous impact.
22) The unexpected attack severely crippled their submarine, effectively stranding them miles beneath the ocean surface amidst a hostile marine environment.
23) They continued their journey with trepidation, eventually discovering a labyrinth sprawling with more of these terrifying sea giants inhabiting the vast gloom.
24) Dubbed as "The Megalodon’s Den", the crew came to realise the audacious marine world they were entangled within.
25) Faced with a dangerous struggle for survival, they had to deal with limited oxygen reserves, encroaching water within the vessel, and the ever-pervasive dread of the circling megalodons, each second ticking away being a match against death.
26) While attempting to salvage their vessel, Max and Zoe stumbled upon what seemed to be an unsanctioned deep-sea mining operation.
27) The operation, run by Blackwater Industries, was ominously located within the deadly depths.
28) Their worst fears were realised as they discovered that the mining activities were ruthlessly mutilating the delicate marine ecosystem, probably triggering the aggressive behaviour of the megalodons.
29) Cornered by these ghastly realities and their primal fear of the undersea predators, Max and Zoe made a steadfast resolve – they would raise their voices against these atrocities.
30) Risking the impending danger awaiting outside the Nautilus, they cautiously ventured out into the monstrous aquatic realm, embarking on a perilous mission to collect compelling evidence against Blackwater Industries' illicit operations.
31) Back inside the Nautilus, the rest of the crew worked with renewed urgency and desperation, attempting to salvage their crippled vessel.
32) Max and Zoe encountered numerous near-death experiences as they ventured deeper into the ocean, roving megalodons bordering their paths.
33) However, they finally managed to land their hands on a significant amount of damning evidence against the mining operation.
34) Their mission complete, they quickly swam back towards the safety of Nautilus, their hearts pounding as relentless predators gave chase.
35) The following hours were marked with frantic struggles as the crew grappled in a suspenseful battle against the incensed megalodons.
36) At the same time, they made desperate attempts to revive the operation of the battered Nautilus.
37) Deciding to risk their final remaining reserves of oxygen, they managed to painfully coax the surviving engines back to life, just as their last breaths were threatening to slip away.
38) Reactivating the propulsion system, the Nautilus shot upwards, barely evading the lethal jaws of a charging megalodon, a thrilling near-miss that left their hearts pounding.
39) Breaking free to the world above the water, they took deep gasping breaths of fresh air, consumed by a combination of relief and shock from the nightmarish ordeal.
40) Even in their weariness, Max and Zoe managed a triumphant smile, basking in their narrow victory against death.
41) They didn't waste any time to procure the needed attention to their shocking discovery.
42) With irrefutable evidence in hand, they exposed Blackwater Industries' illegal mining operations to international media.
43) The revelation resulted in an international scandal, causing global outrage against the criminal corporation.
44) The authorities were quick to respond, promptly shutting down all of Blackwater Industries’ unsanctioned operations.
45) Encouraged by the unplumbed depths of the marine ecosystem discovered, the government approved explorations to scientifically study and protect 'The Megalodon’s Den.'
46) Hailed as environmentalists and heroes, Max and Zoe spearheaded efforts towards the preservation of this newfound underwater sanctuary.
47) As the curtain rolled down on their story, the scene cleverly shifted from the floating Poseidon into the depths of the Mariana trench.
48) The audience was then taken on a hauntingly mesmeric underwater tour deep into an unexplored cavern.
49) The path was eerily lit by an array of soft glows from bioluminescent creatures, the scene dwarfed by an overwhelming panoramic view of the massive cavern.
50) The camera skillfully navigated the labyrinthine cavern, pausing at a particularly intriguing area.
51) The eeriness of the cavern was suddenly shattered by a slow rustling sound.
52) Illuminated by the faint bioluminescence, two gigantic eyes reflected in the camera, invoking a wave of chilling dread in the audience.
53) The eyes blinked menacingly, emanating an ominous aura thick with suspense.
54) As the glow from sea fauna glisten in the creature's eyes, a vast silhouette hinted at a marine creature dwarfing even the indomitable megalodons.
55) Even with the recent publicity around the underwater ecosystem, the introduction of this new, more formidable creature hinted at a cascade of looming threats and unseen dangers.
56) From Max and Zoe's impending battle against more environmental infractions to the terrifying lurking leviathan, the audience was left gripping their seats in anticipation.
57) The narrative ended on a high note, embedding the tantalizing impression of another adrenaline-charged encounter of 'The Megalodon’s Den'.

4. **Third Turning Point (tp3)**: The sentence corresponding to the third turning point is:
"17. Integrating Max's expert navigational knowledge, the team began their astounding descent into the ominous and unsettling depths, where adventure awaited."
Compared to the second turning point, Max is now fully committed to the expedition, utilizing his skills and facing the unknown. This marks a point of no return, where he is deeply invested in the outcome of the journey. His condition remains high, around 8 out of 10, as he is in the midst of an exciting adventure, albeit with growing challenges.

5. **Fourth Turning Point (tp4)**: The sentence corresponding to the fourth turning point is:
"21. In the midst of their initial jubilation, the team was jolted back to reality when an enormous megalodon raced towards the Nautilus, its jaws snapping as it hit the vessel with a thunderous impact."
Relative to the third turning point, Max's situation has taken a drastic turn for the worse. The team faces a severe setback with the attack by the megalodon, which cripples their submarine and puts them in a life-threatening situation. His condition drops significantly to around 2 out of 10, as he and the team are now fighting for survival.

6. **Fifth Turning Point (tp5)**: The sentence corresponding to the fifth turning point is:
"37. Deciding to risk their final remaining reserves of oxygen, they managed to painfully coax the surviving engines back to life, just as their last breaths were threatening to slip away."
Compared to the fourth turning point, Max and the team have managed to turn their desperate situation around, finding a way to reactivate the submarine's engines and escape the depths. This marks a climax where they overcome their major setback. His condition improves dramatically to around 9 out of 10, as they achieve a narrow victory against death and manage to expose the illegal mining operation.

7. **Protagonist's Condition List**: Based on the descriptions, the list of Max's conditions at each turning point in chronological order is:
- First Turning Point: 4
- Second Turning Point: 7
- Third Turning Point: 8
- Fourth Turning Point: 2
- Fifth Turning Point: 9

8. **Classify the Story Arc Type**: Looking at the condition list (4, 7, 8, 2, 9), we can see that Max starts in a somewhat unfulfilled state, improves as he embarks on the adventure, reaches a high point as he commits to it, faces a significant downfall with the megalodon attack, and then recovers to an even higher state after overcoming the challenges and achieving his goal. This pattern follows the **Man in a Hole** story arc type, where the protagonist falls into a dilemma (the megalodon attack and the subsequent survival challenges) but finds a way out, ending better than at the beginning.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) During World War II, President Roosevelt is asked by Colonel Steve Trevor to get the United States involved by creating a team of superhumans.
2) Consisting of Trevor, Black Canary, Hawkman, Hourman, Jay Garrick / Flash, and led by Wonder Woman, the Justice Society of America is formed.In the present, Barry Allen and Iris West picnic in Metropolis, hoping to get away from "work".
3) However, their plans are disrupted by Superman fighting Brainiac.
4) Allen comes to Superman's aid as the Flash.
5) When Brainiac fires a Kryptonite bullet, Flash tries to catch it, but runs fast enough to channel the Speed Force for the first time.
6) Guided by someone's voice, Allen arrives in what he believes is the past during a battle between the JSA and the Nazis.
7) Despite initial confusion over his allegiance, the JSA realizes Allen is an ally and seemingly comes from the future.
8) As the team mobilizes to stop another wave of Nazis, Allen takes Trevor back to the JSA's base and learns about the team, whom he never heard of before.
9) The JSA's next mission involves saving a codebreaker from a Nazi fortress.
10) He can presumably decode a message Trevor stole.
11) Despite the risk of causing a time paradox, the heroes realize they need Allen's help.
12) The heroes and "Shakespeare", the JSA's war correspondent, break in the fortress, defeat the guards, and discover prisoners in the dungeons.
13) A guard attacks Shakespeare, only for the bullets to bounce off of him.
14) Shakespeare's actual name turns out to be Clark Kent.
15) However, he has a different background from the Kent Allen knows.
16) Because of this, Allen realizes that he is in a parallel reality.
17) Meanwhile, the JSA finds the codebreaker, whom Hawkman recognizes as Doctor Fate.
18) Allen recognizes Fate as the man who called out to him.
19) He asks Fate if it is possible for him to return.
20) According to Fate, Barry can return but there is a lesson he needs to learn first and a mission he has to accomplish.
21) Breaking the code with his powers, Fate directs the team to the Bermuda Triangle before disappearing.
22) Arriving at the Triangle by sub, the team is detected by Nazi warships.
23) After depth charges disable the engines, the Flashes jump-start the sub while Wonder Woman attacks the enemy ships.
24) The heroes are saved by Atlantean soldiers, who direct them to a nearby outpost.
25) There, the JSA meets Aquaman, who imprisons them.
26) The code turns out to be a trap and Aquaman is being controlled by the Advisor, a telepathic mercenary who is influencing the Atlanteans to work with the Nazis.
27) The Advisor hopes to destroy them later and take over the planet.
28) The Flashes join forces to break out.
29) The team splits up, with one heading for New York to stop the Nazis and Atlanteans while Allen and Wonder Woman try to stop Aquaman and the Advisor from releasing sea monsters from the Trench.
30) While attacking Manhattan, the Atlantean forces are confronted by the JSA.
31) The heroes gain the upper hand until the monsters arrive, killing Hawkman and wounding Hourman.
32) Garrick and Canary destroy the monsters while Wonder Woman and Allen fight Aquaman.
33) With the help of Trevor, Wonder Woman breaks Aquaman's trident and frees him from the Advisor's control.
34) Realizing what he has done, Aquaman retreats in guilt.
35) The Advisor then reveals that a follow-up strike by Nazi bombers is imminent before killing Trevor with Aquaman's broken weapon.
36) Barry knocks out the Advisor while Kent returns to destroy the bombers.
37) Before dying, Trevor proposes to Wonder Woman, and she accepts.
38) The Advisor regains consciousness and escapes.
39) The JSA vows to avenge Trevor.
40) Before returning to his Earth, Allen says goodbye to the JSA.
41) Wonder Woman gives him the ring Trevor gave her, warning him of holding off for tomorrow.
42) Allen and Garrick use their combined speed to send the former back to the moment he intercepted the bullet.
43) After destroying Brainiac with it, Allen suggests forming a superhero team to combat future threats.
44) He then returns to Iris and proposes to her.
45) She accepts.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 4.5 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.

- Point of No Return (tp3): 18.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 25.5 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 30.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

The protagonist in the story is Barry Allen, also known as the Flash.

### 4. Identify the third turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the second turning point.

However, for the context of Barry Allen's journey, the relevant realization is in sentence 19: "He asks Fate if it is possible for him to return."

### 5. Identify the fourth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the third turning point.

The story arc type can be classified as "Man in a Hole" because the protagonist starts in a challenging situation, improves his condition as he navigates through the story, faces a significant setback, and then recovers and ends in a better state than where he began. 22) The narrative moves to its peak as they reach the summit, only to find an expanse of icy desolation, devoid of the expected treasure - the Serenity Orb.
23) Dejected but not defeated, Arthur spearheads their way back to Dovecliff.
24) He was propelled by the hope that perhaps they missed a crucial clue buried in the ancient folio.
25) In a decisive revelation, Arthur understood the riddle inscribed beneath the cryptic runic symbols.
26) They spoke of the Whispering Depths, a network of caves untouched by Dovecliff's inhabitants for centuries.
27) An inner light reflected on Arthur's face as it dawned on him that the Serenity Orb was probably hidden in the concealed Whispering Depths and not on Mt.
28) Solitaire's frozen peak.
29) Arthur's rekindled spirit, Lucy's unwavering faith, and a weary John, now grappling with Pneumosis, boldly ventured into the shadowy cave system beneath their village.
30) The trio faced countless threatening caves, their faith wavering but never shattering.
31) Eventually, their perseverance led them to the Serenity Orb, a splendid sight to their sore eyes, shining resplendently in the eerie cave.
32) Their moment of triumph, however, was short-lived as the "Summit Seekers" launched a surprise assault on them in the isolated depths of the cave.
33) The ensuing scuffle resulted in John taking a lethal blow to his abdomen, sacrificing himself to shield his young companions from the deadly assault.
34) Despite the crisis, Arthur and Lucy managed to overpower their ambushers, their determination turning the grim situation around.
35) Rushing back to Dovecliff, infected and frantic, they used the Serenity Orb's healing powers.
36) Within a night, the feeble village staggered back to life, and they became the unsung heroes Dovecliff needed.
37) Arthur, desperate to save John, implores the Serenity Orb to spare his life, promising to return the Orb once John recovers.
38) Miraculously, John pulls back from death's grip, and Arthur, true to his word, returns the Orb to its earthen cradle, demonstrating his exceptional integrity.
39) Dovecliff basks in the delight of restored health and peace, as Arthur and Lucy, affirmed their profound love for each other amidst the celebrations, their laughter echoing through the reinvented village.
40) The epilogue unfolds with Margret Ascender, Arthur's matured, wise daughter, narrating the epic journey to her grandchildren, their little eyes full of awe and curiosity.
41) Margret, in her affectionate voice, gently instilled the values of bravery, genuineness, and selflessness in her young listeners, virtues that were her father's legacy.
42) The film ends on a powerful note, highlighting that true heroism isn't about acquiring wealth or chasing fame but about what one is willing to sacrifice for the people and ideals they love.

instruction: Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In the years following Drago and Gareth's bonding, the seven dragons they raised left to different lands; one of them, a female named Siveth, traveled to Wallachia.
2) The kingdom and its ruler, King Razvan, initially welcomed Siveth, but after he was wounded in battle, Siveth refused to share her heart with him, so the king exiled her.
3) Twenty or thirty years after, Lukas, a young farmer, sees his family killed by savage raiders: The Bear, The Wolf, The Snake, and The Scorpion.
4) After losing his parents and house to them, Lukas leaves on a quest for revenge.
5) Lukas goes to the city where King Razvan rules, begging for help, only to be turned down.
6) Later, a swashbuckling mercenary, Darius, approaches Lukas, offering his services to hunt the murderers.
7) A brawl breaks out between Darius and a rival group of mercenaries, forcing Lukas to flee.
8) He learns from a blacksmith he meets that Siveth might help him.
9) Lukas travels deep into the countryside to find Siveth, offering her a bag of crop seed as payment.
10) Realizing that Lukas wants vengeance instead of justice, Siveth refuses to help, so Lukas leaves.
11) He soon finds a horse with a saddle and supplies to aid him in his journey.
12) Darius, who followed him, teaches Lukas how to fight.
13) Pursuing The Bear first, Darius and Lukas follow his trail and discover that Siveth has traveled with them, disguised as Lukas' horse.
14) Darius departs after a heated argument with Siveth, leaving her and Lukas to face The Bear and his band of raiders.
15) While trying to kill Lukas during the fight, The Bear falls to his death, pleasing Lukas much to Siveth's dismay.
16) They later subdue The Wolf.
17) Lukas threatens to kill him, but Siveth says The Wolf is more valuable alive, so they take him captive when he agrees to lead them to The Snake and Scorpion.
18) The Wolf keeps his word but, as Darius blunders into the ambush, he escapes, losing an arm to Siveth's ice breath.
19) Despite this, they capture The Snake, and Lukas learns Siveth and Darius are bonded.
20) Questioning what to do with their prisoner, Siveth tells Lukas to spare her and take her back to town to face justice, while Darius says to kill the raider; to dissuade Darius, Siveth explains why she shared her heart with him.
21) When Darius was a child, the king started a war to bolster his popularity and distract people from his corrupt dealings; the king was wounded in battle while Siveth tried to prove his corruption.
22) The king had his wagon driver run Darius's parents off the road during his return to the castle, killing them.
23) Siveth then shared her heart with Darius to save him, leading to her refusal to help Razvan and her banishment.
24) She kept the truth from Darius to protect him.
25) Darius reluctantly agrees to spare The Snake, having discovered the raiders were receiving coded messages.
26) After delivering The Snake to the local jail, Darius decodes the messages and learns that King Razvan is behind the raiders' attacks, ordering them to kill his subjects to prevent starvation because he did not prepare for food shortages.
27) Meanwhile, Lukas, with Siveth's help, flirts with Oana, the town healer, having met her earlier.
28) The Scorpion returns for The Snake and frees her, poisoning Oana's father, the town's jailer, and setting his house ablaze to cover their escape; Siveth uses her ice breath to douse the flames and regroups with Darius and Lukas.
29) Darius tells them his discovery, so Siveth tries to retrieve the raiders' orders from the king's guards who took them.
30) As Siveth uses her shapeshifting to try and reclaim the evidence, Lukas and Darius pursue The Snake and Scorpion, wandering into an ambush.
31) During the fight, The Scorpion poisons Lukas, and The Snake further wounds him in battle.
32) Darius is also injured, and Siveth abandons her mission to save Lukas and Darius after seeing them in trouble through their bond.
33) Darius kills The Scorpion, and Siveth kills The Snake.
34) Lukas apologizes for letting revenge darken his heart.
35) Darius and Siveth also reconcile, and he begs her to save Lukas.
36) Siveth takes Lukas to the monastery where Darius was raised; weeks pass, and Lukas recovers with Oana's help.
37) King Razvan and a crowd of townsfolk confront Lukas and Siveth shortly thereafter; the king orders Lukas to be surrendered for crimes he did not commit and orders Siveth to resume her exile.
38) However, Siveth refuses, calling Razvan out for his crimes against the people.
39) Then Darius and the recaptured Wolf appear, with The Wolf revealing his part in Razvan's schemes.
40) Siveth offers her protection to anyone else willing to speak up; more people come forward from the king's guards and council to confess to Razvan's corruption, leading to his and The Wolf's imprisonment.
41) In the time that follows, Siveth is welcomed back into society and shares the crop seed she saved to end the local famine.
42) Lukas rebuilds his home, beginning a relationship with Oana.
43) Now recognized by the kingdom for his bond with Siveth, Darius lives a happy life among the people.
44) Darius reflects on Siveth's teachings, acknowledging that she showed him and Lukas the path to happiness, friendship, and love.

Cinderella

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In the high-stress district of Chicago deemed Wall Street West, John Morrison stands, his aura radiating an infectious charisma.
2) Morrison is an asset to the financial juggernaut, Lion Hart International.
3) However, behind the doors of his Harbor Point condominium, a private war rages against a lingering nostrum from his past - alcoholism.
4) A monstrous global financial crisis casts its menacing shadow.
5) The world's colossal corporations crumble, and even Lion Hart is markedly affected.
6) In a few weeks, the once bustling trading floor of Lion Hart morphs into a quiet tomb, the silence broken intermittently by the melody of unanswered telephones.
7) Despite his acumen, Morrison finds himself on the unfortunate list of employees borne away in the wave of layoffs.
8) As he watches his affluent life being swept away by this tide, Morrison grapples with the resurgence of his old foe, alcoholism, in the stark silence of his cavernous, luxury apartment.
9) Morrison, in the spirit born of a lifetime of relentless competition, starts delving into confidential files of Lion Hart's financial transactions of the past decade.
10) Hours of intense scrutiny unearth concerning financial trends pointing towards potential fraudulent practices.
11) Morrison, assailed from within by the thrall of alcohol and externally by the daunting task of exposing the truth, reaches out to his former colleagues, only to be met with disbelief, resistance, and outright denial.
12) He embarks on a solitary quest for justice against Lion Hart.
13) He manoeuvres through a swamp of corporate malpractice, clandestine dealings, and revengeful secrets, his opponents circling him—mute brokers, ironclad executives, powerful business magnates.
14) When a business tycoon uncovers Morrison's covert endeavour, his ex-wife and daughter become the targets of unknown assailants.
15) The confrontation escalates as Morrison struggles to protect his family, while simultaneously pushing forward in his mission to reveal Lion Hart's transgressions.
16) An unexpected lifeline arrives in the form of a former Lion Hart colleague, who steps forward with sympathy and invaluable information needed to decipher Lion Hart's schemes.
17) As Morrison's discovery sparks a media frenzy, Lion Hart descends into chaos, its conference hall no longer a bastion of power but a sudden battleground as the company’s top brass face a federal indictment.
18) Backed into the corner, Morrison rises, unyielding, as a beacon of truth.
19) He takes steady strides on his road to sobriety, and his diligent work to rebuild relationships with his estranged family is paid with deeper bonds.
20) His story captures the nation's interest, including leading media houses, all desiring to host him and share his journey.
21) His account of corporate corruption on a live CNN interview leaves the nation spellbound, propelling him from being an unlikely hero to a symbol of hope for others struggling against their own inner demons.
22) As Morrison's tale of perseverance and pursuit of truth reaches millions, it becomes a beacon of hope for those wrestling with their shadows.
23) The film concludes on the powerful image of this once-time alcoholic turned national hero.
24) His story echoes the resonant call to rise above all adversities, regardless of how formidable the odds may be.

instruction: Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) A young woman, Xochitl, cuts the tires of an SUV and leaves a bright yellow one-page manifesto on the window.
2) In Long Beach, California, Xochitl and her friend Theo witness the devastating effects of climate change.
3) Xochitl's mother dies during a heat wave in a city plagued by pollution from oil refineries.
4) Frustrated by the slow progress of their campus divestment campaign, Xochitl expresses a desire for more radical environmental action.
5) Theo is diagnosed with terminal cancer caused by the pollution, adding a sense of urgency to their cause.
6) Theo and Xochitl convince Theo's skeptical girlfriend, Alisha, and a number of other individuals, to plot an act of environmental terrorism.
7) Shawn, a film student who met Xochitl through the divestment movement, introduces the group to Dwayne, a blue-collar Texan with deep resentment towards an oil company that used eminent domain laws to seize his family's ancestral land, depriving him and his pregnant wife of their home.
8) The team also recruits Michael, a Native American self-taught explosives expert from a North Dakota reservation.
9) Completing the group are Rowan and Logan, an adventurous young couple drawn to the cause.
10) United by their shared belief that non-disruptive action is insufficient, the group devises a plan to strategically detonate homemade explosives along an unguarded section of a recently constructed oil pipeline in West Texas.
11) The pipeline is partially built on Dwayne's land; his intimate knowledge of the targeted area helps the group plan the attack.
12) They hope that the destruction of the segment will force the company to shut down its Texas operations for a period of time, causing crude oil prices worldwide to spike due to their indexing to West Texas crude.
13) The group gathers at a remote cabin, where they begin manufacturing explosives and digging up a section of the pipeline.
14) While executing their plan, the group encounters several setbacks and challenges.
15) Members of the crew are distracted by alcohol, Michael accidentally detonates a primer charge during preparation, a surveillance drone monitors their activities, and Alisha fractures her leg when a barrel of explosives falls on her.
16) Rowan and Logan, entrusted to prevent local pollution by shutting off the pipeline flow, find themselves unexpectedly confronted by armed company property inspectors.
17) Logan successfully distracts them while Rowan completes the task.
18) In the process, he sustains a gunshot wound.
19) Despite these challenges, the group successfully blows up the pipeline.
20) Xochitl broadcasts a triumphant message on Instagram calling others to action.
21) Following the explosion, the group scatters and Rowan tends to Logan's injuries, removing bullet fragments from his shoulder.
22) She then discreetly meets with two FBI agents.
23) Xochitl knowingly included Rowan, an FBI informant, in their plan, enabling them to outwit federal and local police by convincing them that only Theo and Xochitl were involved in the sabotage.
24) Rowan secures her freedom (having previously faced legal consequences following her involvement in a similar incident) and receives a substantial reward for her information.
25) Michael, Alisha, Shawn, and Dwayne quickly establish alibis placing them away from the scene.
26) The police find the cabin where the group had manufactured the explosives just moments after Theo and Xochitl detonate a final bomb inside.
27) The duo peacefully surrenders as planned.
28) Theo and Xochitl are sentenced to lengthy prison terms, though Theo dies shortly afterwards.
29) While the other group members remain free, family members suspect their involvement, federal agents monitor their actions, and they reflect on their decisions.
30) Finally, another act of sabotage is shown.
31) Inspired by the West Texas group, a trio of masked individuals plant a bomb in a Miami yacht, leaving behind the same manifesto seen earlier.
