instruction: Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In 1957, Billie Holiday meets with a radio journalist, Reginald Lord Devine, for an interview.
2) He asks her what it is like to be a "colored woman" and about the trouble she keeps getting into because of her hit song "Strange Fruit".
3) Billie says it is about human rights, something the government often forgets.
4) In 1947, Billie's husband Monroe and her manager Joe Glaser try to get Billie to cut "Strange Fruit" from her set list, saying people high up in the government do not want to hear her sing it.
5) Lester Young, Billie's sax player, supports her in playing it.
6) In the 1940s, FBN chief Harry J. Anslinger tells agents that Billie is a threat, her song promotes the wrong ideas, and she has not stopped singing it.
7) Unable to arrest her for singing, they decide to go after her on drug charges.
8) After Billie's next show, Agent Jimmy Fletcher, disguised as a soldier, witnesses her doing drugs.
9) The FBI arrest Billie and her lover Joe Guy for drug use and possession.
10) The judge sentences Billie to a year in jail.
11) It is later revealed that Anslinger paid off Guy.
12) Anslinger tells Jimmy that they need to make sure Billie never sings again.
13) Jimmy questions why Billie is such a problem.
14) Anslinger tells Fletcher to go to the prison to get back in with Billie.
15) Instead, he tells her to not trust anyone and warns her the FBI will continue to try to set her up.
16) After Billie is released from prison, she does a Carnegie Hall show, where an audience member asks her to sing "Strange Fruit" and she sadly declines.
17) Billie meets John Levy, who tells her that he will pay off the right people to make sure she can keep singing in his clubs.
18) They begin a relationship.
19) Levy proposes to her, then slips drugs into her pocket just in time for the FBI to enter.
20) In court, Fletcher admits that Billie was possibly framed, and she is freed.
21) Anslinger sends Fletcher to follow Billie on her tour.
22) In 1949, Jimmy comes to see Billie after a successful tour stop and tells her the agency wants her to think he was fired.
23) Suspicious, the whole crew has Jimmy do heroin to show he can be trusted.
24) Over the course of the tour, Jimmy and Billie fall in love.
25) One day, after the bus breaks down, Billie breaks up with Jimmy, telling him he needs to find a nice girl, and that is not her.
26) Jimmy returns to work, where he finds he has been replaced.
27) Billie marries Louis McKay, later returning to Jimmy.
28) Later, Billie tells Jimmy she has liver failure.
29) In the hospital, Anslinger tells Billie and McKay that if she cooperates, she will never see them again.
30) Billie tells him that his grandkids will be singing "Strange Fruit" one day.

1. **Identify the protagonist in the story**: The protagonist of the story is Billie Holiday.

2. **First turning point (tp1) description**: The sentence corresponding to the first turning point (Opportunity) is:
   - In 1947, Billie's husband Monroe and her manager Joe Glaser try to get Billie to cut "Strange Fruit" from her set list, saying people high up in the government do not want to hear her sing it.

8) Bill meets with Ted again in 1986.
9) Ted is shown crime scene photos of the Green River case and gives his assessment on the patterns of the elusive murderer.
10) Through Bill's calculating questioning, Ted discloses information about his own patterns.
11) Ted asks Bill if he could kill someone.
12) Bill explains that, due to his being an FBI agent, it could happen, but this answer is not what Ted was seeking.
13) Back in Quantico, Virginia, Unit Chief Roger Depue cautions Bill not to get too close to someone like Bundy.
14) While sharing stories about their children during their next meeting in 1987, Ted senses that Bill is getting too deep in his mind and taunts him to speculate on what he would do if he escaped from prison.
15) Bill describes it with a good amount of accuracy and Ted verbally attacks Bill, then settles down and begins to disclose more intimate details of his life and what may have led him to murder but dispels the myths about him.
16) He reveals that he and Bill could easily change places, which deeply afflicts Bill.
17) As Ted is lobbying for a stay of execution in 1989, Governor Martinez signs the death warrant, and Ted is to die by electrocution in seven days.
18) Hearing of the execution, the media and a crowd begin to mass outside the prison.
19) Ted is now ready to confess his crimes but will only speak with Bill.
20) Though Bill is supervising interviews with investigators from several states, he arrives to find Ted's civil attorney, Carolyn Lieberman, taking charge.
21) Ted believes holding back certain information could overturn the execution, buying him more time for further details.
22) Carolyn doesn't want Bill's influence as an FBI agent at the interviews but Ted insists he attends, calling Bill his best friend.
23) Bill urges Ted not to play games with the governor and asks how many women he killed.
24) Ted confesses to 30 deaths.
25) At the interviews, Ted is evasive with his answers, only divulging information to a few murders.
26) Ignoring Bill's conditions that no media is to be involved, Carolyn schedules Ted to interview with Dr. James Dobson, an influential evangelical Christian author and psychologist, whom she believes will help with a pardon.
27) After the interview, Dobson reveals to Carolyn the governor was never going to grant the pardon.
28) A day before the execution, the warden informs Bill that a last-minute sanity hearing will take place.
29) While multiple consultations will be conducted, the decision to proceed with the execution will rest entirely on Bill's testimony to a psychiatric board, which ultimately declares Ted sane.
30) Outside the prison, the spirited crowd grows in anticipation, while inside Bill assists Ted in writing a letter to his mother.
31) Bill asks to be taken under the water.
32) With harsh details, Ted exposes how he lured and killed a victim, which leaves Bill overwhelmed and in tears.
33) That night, Ted thanks Bill for being a friend to him.
34) Ted suddenly threatens suicide, but Bill is hardened by the ultimatum.
35) Ted has an outburst of desperation, asking why it's happening to him, still showing no remorse for his crimes.
36) Infuriated, Bill exclaims his victims didn't prepare for death.
37) Ted takes to his knees in prayer.
38) As Bill prepares to leave, Ted asks him if he understands why he killed.
39) Bill tells him, "Because you wanted to."
40) Just moments before the execution, Bill learns he has been removed as a witness to the execution and others will take his place.
41) Left alone in the warden's office, Bill makes a phone call to his family.
42) While Bill is speaking with his son, the crowd outside erupts in cheers as Bundy is declared dead.

12) Domino tells Andrew she has a fiancé, Joseph, working in Chicago.
13) She reveals the blood was not from her period but caused by a recent miscarriage.
14) Domino hires Andrew as Lola's sitter.
15) They kiss.
16) Andrew later has sex with his friend, Macy.
17) Andrew spends the next day talking to David and interviewing for a job as an intern.
18) Andrew meets Joseph at a party and later spends time with Domino and Lola.
19) Andrew starts to think Maya is dating someone in Barcelona; his mother comforts him.

21) Andrew sees Domino and Joseph in a bad mood before he leaves.
22) Andrew gets the intern job.
23) He and Domino talk about her engagement with Joseph and they kiss.
24) Back home, Andrew and David have an argument.
25) Joseph fires Andrew from his job as Lola's sitter.
26) David almost experiences his first kiss but leaves to stop some kids bullying Lola.
27) A fight between Andrew's family and the other guests at the bar mitzvah ensues.
28) Andrew tells Domino he loves her.
29) She rejects his advances, telling him that she is in love with Joseph, even when it does not appear she is.
30) Joseph thanks Andrew for taking care of his family.

33) Andrew and Domino say goodbye.
34) She encourages him to live his life to the fullest before making any commitments.
35) David tells Andrew he had his first kiss at school.

4. **Third turning point (Point of No Return)**: The sentence for tp3 is "15. They kiss." At this point, Andrew's relationship with Domino has become romantic, marking a significant commitment and change in their dynamic. His condition can be seen as having reached a high point, around 9 out of 10, because he has achieved a level of intimacy and connection with Domino, which is a major development in his personal life.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) After escaping the "sole survivor" escape rooms orchestrated by the Minos Corporation, Zoey Davis and Ben Miller decide to confront the shadowy organization after finding coordinates to its New York City–based headquarters.
2) Zoey is encouraged by her therapist to move on from her trauma and to get over her aerophobia, but she opts to drive with Ben instead of flying.
3) The pair find the headquarters derelict and are accosted by a vagrant who steals Zoey's necklace.
4) She and Ben give chase straight into the Q subway train.
5) Their train car separates from the rest of the train and is redirected to a remote station, sealing Zoey, Ben, and other passengers Rachel, Brianna, Nathan, and Theo inside.
6) As the passengers realize in horror that they are once again in Minos' deadly game, the train becomes electrified.
7) Zoey and Ben learn that the others are the "winners" of previous escape rooms, having survived them.
8) To escape, the group must collect subway tokens as the electrification increases.
9) Theo is killed while the rest escape.
10) Nathan reveals his escape room group were all priests, Brianna's were all influencers, and Rachel's consisted of people who cannot feel physical pain.
11) The next room is a bank with a slowly closing vault and a deadly laser security system.
12) The group manages to decipher the complex route to get around the lasers and escape with just seconds to spare.
13) While in the room, Zoey is perplexed by frequent references to someone called Sonya and that the escape rooms have no apparent connection to the group unlike before.
14) The next room is a postcard-like beach with more references to Sonya.
15) They discover that the beach is covered in quicksand.
16) While Rachel is sinking, Nathan sacrifices himself to save Rachel and is swallowed up by the sand.
17) Zoey finds an alternate route out just as Brianna unlocks the intended exit.
18) An argument on which route to take breaks out; Rachel and Ben side with Zoey.
19) Brianna escapes through the main exit while Rachel and Zoey traverse to the alternate route, but Ben falls into the quicksand.
20) Zoey and Rachel make their way out through a manhole back into the city.
21) Overjoyed at first that they are outside, they quickly realize they are still in the game when they encounter a panicked Brianna.
22) If they do not make it out of this room, acid rain is periodically sprayed on them.
23) The group opens a taxi to escape into but once Zoey enters, the taxi locks Rachel and Brianna out.
24) Zoey falls into the next room while Rachel and Brianna succumb to the rain and die.
25) The next room is a child's bedroom containing a diary from Sonya, revealing the rooms are based on a fun day out she had with her mother.
26) Zoey discovers Sonya's mother is Amanda Harper, who survived her fall in her original escape room and was forced into designing escape rooms for Minos after they abducted her daughter.
27) Amanda appears and begs Zoey to become the next puzzle-maker for Minos, warning that she has no choice.
28) Ben is revealed to be trapped in a cage.
29) When Zoey refuses Minos' demand, Ben's cage starts filling with water, but Zoey and Amanda work together to free him.
30) They manage to break out, fleeing the facility.
31) They report their findings to the police, who retrieve the bodies of Rachel, Brianna, Nathan, and Theo; the news about Minos goes public.
32) An FBI agent assures Zoey that Minos will be tracked down.
33) Filled with confidence, Zoey decides to take a plane home with Ben.
34) Onboard, she sees a woman who resembles her therapist, and then realizes she is in another escape room.
35) The distorted voice of Minos' leader mocks Zoey and Ben for falling into their latest trap as the plane begins to fall and gas fills the cabin.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The film begins with the scene of Jordan Miller, an extraordinary nine-year-old child, tossing and turning in bed, ensnared in an uproarious dream involving a bumbling tooth fairy with oversized wings that seem to function less effectively than a broken fan.
2) The absurdity of the dream resonates with an underlying essence of fear, causing Jordan to wake up in a chilly sweat.
3) The narrative takes us to an affluent neighborhood where Jordan resides in a tastefully furnished bungalow.
4) On the exterior, he is adored by individuals within his community, cherished by friends, but each night is a sequence of absurd yet terrifying dreams weaving an eerie tapestry in his young mind.
5) To help the child grapple with these overwhelmingly vivid dreams, Jordan's parents seek the expertise of Dr. Rose, a revered therapist renowned for her humanistic approach interlaced with an uncompromising staunchness.
6) Dr. Rose, through her empathetic counselling, proposes a unique idea to Jordan- maintaining a journal of his nightmares.
7) A striking black leather-bound book then becomes the deposit box for Jordan's self-stylized dream sequences.
8) An otherwise regular school routine takes an eerie twist when Jordan's dream-orchestrated alternate reality starts wiggling its way into routine activities like fetching milk from the cafeteria or completing assignments, layering them with portions of the ridiculous.
9) Amidst the chaos, Jordan's black leather journal documenting his so-called “Circus of Nightmares” finds its way into 'Book Haven', a bookstore frequented by locals, by an accidental misplacement.
10) Patrons of 'Book Haven' stumble upon Jordan's journal mistaking it for an eccentrically illustrated masterpiece, leading to an unexpected surge in its popularity and swiftly taking it on a merry ride to the bookstore’s bestseller list.
11) Max Wilde, a Hollywood director known for his penchant for the whimsical, finds himself intrigued by this bizarre bestseller.
12) Recognizing its potential, he envisions a comedy goldmine waiting to be unearthed by turning Jordan's nightly theatre into a script.
13) Max springs an unexpected proposition on Jordan, illuminating his plan to metamorphose Jordan's journal into a screenplay.
14) The prospect is initially met with resistance from Jordan but slowly, he begins to see its comedic potential.
15) Jordan finally agrees to Max's unusual project.
16) His apprehension is gradually replaced with anticipation, hoping to convert his fears into a comedy of errors.
17) Filming begins with Jordan's preposterously imaginative characters like extraterrestrial purple kangaroos and wing-embellished pigs morphing into reality, eliciting peals of laughter from the set.
18) The once-quiet film set, now transformed into Jordan's dream turned reality with singing frogs, tumbling tooth fairies, and clumsy aliens, becomes a breeding ground for staged confusion and unrehearsed hilarity.
19) Witnessing his fears transformed into a comedy act strengthens Jordan's resolve to face his underlying alarums head-on, helping him progressively heal with every burst of laughter on set.
20) The roller-coaster journey of filming the ridiculous finally concludes, leaving Jordan relieved, and, curiously, entertained.
21) A grand movie premiere is arranged at Hollywood's prestigious theatre.
22) It showcases the marvelous transformation of Jordan's grotesque nightmares into a comedic decree, leaving the audience doubled with laughter.
23) The Jordan that once feared nights, now stands in the spotlight as a sensational comedy figure, laughing at the absurdities of his fears and turning them into popular amusement.
24) At the rooster's call, he abruptly wakes up, chuckling at the newfound realization that his rise to stardom was all part of his ever-vibrant dreamscape.
25) Now brimming with humorous twists thanks to his dreams, Jordan awaits his next appointment with Dr. Rose, thrilled to share his transformed dreams with her.
26) In a reality-twisting sequence, Jordan wakes up once again and accepts that his entire journey from losing the journal to the grand movie premiere was a dream within a dream.
27) With his fears splayed open and laughed at, Jordan wakes up feeling invincible and liberated from latent fears, replaced by an infectious, unshakeable grin.
28) The film wraps up on a cheerful note with Jordan sharing his latest dream escapades with Dr. Rose.

input:
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Tom sits in his bustling office in New York City.
2) He is a 35-year-old telemarketer, often finding his eyes drifting away from his work to imagine a different life in a quiet town on the Irish coast.
3) One frost-kissed December evening, he stumbles upon a handcrafted pocket watch among his grandmother's leftover possessions.
4) The watch's Celtic symbols and shining emeralds stir a hidden flux of emotions in him.
5) Fatigue takes over and Tom falls asleep.
6) Vivid dreams take over, painting a picturesque panorama of the quaint seaside town he often dreams of.
7) At the stroke of midnight, the pocket watch springs to life, radiating a soft azure glow.
8) Tom wakes up, not in his city apartment but on the lush rolling hills of his dreams - Dunmore East.
9) He soon learns about the tyrant of the town, Maev.
10) The relentless torment of the townsfolk tugs at his heartstrings, propelling him to intervene.
11) Spotting an opportunity during an ambush, he swiftly jumps into action, fighting for the innocent lives at risk.
12) Throughout the unfamiliar journey, Tom encounters Sarah.
13) There is undeniable chemistry between the two.
14) Sarah becomes his lifeline, guiding him emotionally and strategically in the fight against the villainous rule of Maev.
15) Their bond deepens, fortifying his resolve against tyranny.
16) Desperate to dismantle Tom's escalating influence, Maev hatches a sinister plan.
17) The brewing storm of uncertainty hangs heavy, dampening Tom’s spirits.
18) Refusing to abandon Sarah and the townsfolk to the malevolent Maev, Tom strategizes a daring rescue mission.
19) Rallying the very people he set out to protect, Tom ignites a rebellion.
20) The climax of the narrative climaxes with an intense battle between Tom and Maev.
21) Defying all expectations, Tom vanquishes Maev.
22) The liberation of Sarah and the children signifies the end of Maev's reign.
23) As a last attempt to regain control, Maev manipulates the magical pocket watch, and Tom finds himself back in his New York City apartment.
24) Tom wakes up to the realization of his stark, cramped apartment.
25) The pocket watch lay beside him.
26) Its magic exhausted but its existence served as a reminder of his brave deeds.
27) Fresh from his adventures, Tom decides to confront his stagnant reality, tackles and fights for his professional aspirations, and earns a promotion to a managerial position.
28) Inspired by his dream, Tom decides to meet his fantasies halfway and books a ticket to Ireland.
29) As he treads lightly on the warm sandy beach, he spots a lone woman sitting alone on the beach.
30) As he draws closer, he is astounded by her uncanny resemblance to Sarah, his dreamed lover and accomplice.
31) Tom introduces himself.
32) To his relief and bewilderment, the woman responds with an equally warm familiarity.
33) As their encounter ends with a knowing smile, Tom's dreams and reality intertwine, leaving the audience to question if his dream remained a mere subconscious imagination or was it a cryptic introduction to a life he was destined to explore.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 3.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 7.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 10.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 16.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 20.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").
output:
To classify the story arc type, let's follow the steps outlined:

1. **Identify the protagonist in the story**: The protagonist is Tom, a 35-year-old telemarketer.

2. **First turning point (Opportunity - tp1)**: Sentence 3 - "One frost-kissed December evening, he stumbles upon a handcrafted pocket watch among his grandmother's leftover possessions." 
   - At this point, Tom's state is one of discovery and potential change. His condition can be approximated as a 4, indicating a neutral to slightly positive state due to the introduction of an element that could change his life.

3. **Second turning point (Change of Plans - tp2)**: Sentence 7 - "At the stroke of midnight, the pocket watch springs to life, radiating a soft azure glow."
   - Relative to the first turning point, Tom's condition changes significantly as he is transported to the place he has always dreamed of, indicating a rise in his condition to a 7. This reflects his transition from a mundane life to one filled with magic and possibility.

4. **Third turning point (Point of No Return - tp3)**: Sentence 10 - "The relentless torment of the townsfolk tugs at his heartstrings, propelling him to intervene."
   - Compared to the second turning point, Tom's condition becomes more committed and involved. His emotional investment in the town's plight deepens, but the situation is challenging, so his condition might be approximated as an 8. This indicates a high level of engagement and purpose.

5. **Fourth turning point (Major Setback - tp4)**: Sentence 16 - "Desperate to dismantle Tom's escalating influence, Maev hatches a sinister plan."
   - Relative to the third turning point, Tom faces a significant challenge with Maev's plan, which likely lowers his condition to a 5. This represents a downturn due to the increased danger and uncertainty.

6. **Fifth turning point (Climax - tp5)**: Sentence 20 - "The climax of the narrative climaxes with an intense battle between Tom and Maev."
   - Compared to the fourth turning point, Tom's condition improves dramatically as he confronts and defeats Maev, marking a significant victory. This can be approximated as a 10, indicating the best possible condition due to his success and the liberation of the town.

7. **List of protagonist's condition at each turning point**: [4, 7, 8, 5, 10]

8. **Classify the story arc type**: Based on the list [4, 7, 8, 5, 10], the story arc type can be classified as **Cinderella**. The reasoning behind this classification is as follows:
   - The protagonist starts in a relatively neutral or low state (4).
   - He rises to a higher state (7) as he enters a new and promising situation.
   - His condition improves further (8) as he becomes more involved and committed.
   - He then faces a setback (5), which lowers his condition temporarily.
   - Finally, he achieves a high state (10) by overcoming the challenges and achieving his goals.
   This pattern of rising, facing a setback, and then ultimately achieving a higher state than where he started is characteristic of the **Cinderella** story arc.

9. **Determined story arc type**: Cinderella

1) Amy Rodriguez, born and bred in the unassuming town of Maple Edge, serves her purpose as a bartender at a beloved traditional Irish pub known as 'O'Connell's Tavern.'
2) The town may be sleepy, but inside of Amy roars a passion for music that her dull daily activities cannot quell.
3) Throughout her nightly duties — filling pints to the brim with effervescing beer and taking orders for mouth-watering burgers — Amy is frequently distracted.
4) She finds herself taking a moment here and there to scribble melody lines on any napkin she can find, soaking either partially from beer drippings or condensation off the cold glasses.
5) A muse whispering charming melodies in her mind is more often than not the reason behind this.
6) During a particularly lively Friday night, the droning hum of chatter and banter inside the pub gives way to an entertaining unplanned jam session.
7) Amy musters the courage to join in, her years of musically-infused solitude now seeping into the very fabric of the gathering.
8) Among the hypnotized crowd are distinct souls with a shared predisposition towards music: John, a car mechanic and drummer; Peter, an elementary school teacher and bassist, and Rebecca, a local artist also renowned for her vocals, form a trio of intrigued listeners.
9) The shared affinity for music amongst the foursome takes their bond well beyond ordinary friendship, and they decided to form a band: 'The Faithful.'
10) Amy, now the lead vocalist of a band, experiences her lifelong dream unfurl and take flight as 'The Faithful' becomes a mainstay at 'O'Connell's Tavern.'
11) They managed to brew a dedicated fan-base, their unusually beautiful harmony attracting listeners from near and far to the tavern.
12) One fateful night, Leonard Crane, owner of a platinum music label, walks into 'O'Connell's Tavern,' gets lost in the ethereal harmony the band creates, and offers to sign 'The Faithful' on his label.
13) Life, previously an unvaried palette, is now an interesting blend of companionship and orchestrated symphony as the prospect of being introduced into the world of professional music brings in a wave of ecstasy.
14) The joy is short-lived as songwriting proves to be a point of conflict within the group.
15) Personal narratives and musical styles clash, and friction starts to creep in between the members.
16) The issue takes on a different hue when Leonard provides Amy exclusive rights to her songs.
17) This sows the seeds of discord among the band members.
18) Amy steps up as the calming influence and urges the group to hold firm to their passion for music and keep the unity that gave birth to 'The Faithful' intact.
19) Through her consistent efforts, the unhealthy tension within the band starts to ebb.
20) Rejuvenated and more driven than ever, 'The Faithful' return to their practice sessions.
21) However, Leonard Crane abruptly backs out of his promise and leaves 'The Faithful' feeling betrayed.
22) Amy proposes they independently produce their debut album and, staying true to their indomitable resolve, 'The Faithful' pour their hearts and souls into their music, carefully embellishing the debut album with their life experiences.
23) Each track serves as a tribute to their journey so far, and the result is a musical feast that becomes a testament to their journey.
24) This representation is released in a grand concert at 'O'Connell's Tavern,' marking their entry into the professional music industry.
25) Their emotionally-charged tale of struggle, unity, and victory reaches Ethan Brooks, a renowned concert organizer.
26) He offers 'The Faithful' the chance to join his upcoming music tour.
27) Invigorated and humbled, 'The Faithful' bid farewell to 'O'Connell's Tavern' and step onto the grand stage of 'Broadway Music Stadium.'
28) They perform their journey through lyrical stories, and they received a roaring applause from the audience.
29) Their debut concert concludes with the tale of 'The Faithful' serving as a poignant reminder of the power of dreams, perseverance, unity, and above all, faith.
30) At the end of the concert, the stadium erupts with applause, immortalizing an unforgettable night for 'The Faithful' and their fans.

25) The thunderous standing ovation rattles Nicole's spirit, leaving her overwhelmed with disbelief and gratitude.
26) The unforgettable night culminates with the family sharing a moving group hug on the stage, an iconic symbol of their newly discovered familial bond.
27) Post the concert, the twins start to gradually embrace the concept of a complete family, craving for the emotional warmth they had missed all these years.
28) Nicole's apartment, which once reeked of loneliness, is now bustling with the lively visits and chatter of the twins.
29) Now known by the thriving music community in New York, Nicole embarks on a rekindled musical journey.
30) Her mesmerizing performances at popular local venues hold everyone spellbound as her bewitching melodies waft through the air.
31) The scene wraps up with a tender family embrace on the stage, embodying unity, redemption, and the power of familial love and support.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Our saga starts with Emily, a resolute and intellectually poised astronomer from Harvard University, passionately analyzing astral bodies in the seamless expanse of space from her top-tier observatory.
2) On a particular bone-chilling winter night, her ultra-sensitive computer systems power on unexpectedly, revealing a worrisome interstellar image of an enormous meteor, roughly half the size of the moon, charging towards Earth at a fearsome velocity.
3) Shockwaves of chaos ripple through global scientific communities after Emily's blood-chilling revelation of impending doom, as esteemed experts scramble to analyze this potentially horrific event.
4) Deep in the heart of the Amazon rainforest, Jack, a remarkably adaptable and meticulous biologist hailing from Stanford, delves into the complex world of reptilian genetics, embarking on individual animal studies.
5) Jack's groundbreaking research, which was initially concentrated on the reproduction patterns of common reptiles, emerges as a significant turning point as the impending catastrophe, predicted by Emily, begins to take shape.
6) In a massive burst of cosmic energy, the colossal meteorite plunges towards Earth, showering bizarre emerald-tinted debris, significantly affecting the African continental expanse.
7) Following this cosmic event, a tense silence conquers the planet initially.
8) However, the calm is alarmingly disrupted by an epidemic of strange reptilian mutations linked to enhanced breeding rates, a probable side-effect of the alien meteor remains.
9) This genetic mutation, bizarre and unparalleled, spurs an abnormal growth surge among these affected reptiles, resulting in creatures as mammoth as the majestic blue whale, exuding chaos of unimaginable magnitude across the globe.
10) Upon noticing this paradoxical growth surge, Jack swiftly pieces together a terrifying connection between the increase in reptile size and the impact of the cosmic debris, drawing him into the whirlpool of Emily's planetary crisis.
11) Recognizing the urgent need for cooperative action despite their diverse fields of study, Emily, the esteemed astronomer, and Jack, the revered biologist, join forces to curtail the gargantuan threat to humanity.
12) The grotesque reptiles breed exponentially, invoking dread everywhere while causing unparalleled destruction spanned across world monuments, from the Great Wall of China to the Eiffel Tower.
13) Manhattan, the vibrant epicenter of New York City, morphs into an unexpected battlefield as these unfathomably gigantic creatures engage in a harrowing showdown amidst the city's famous skyscrapers.
14) Witnessing the unrestrained force of these behemoths, the city crumbles under their raw power, toppling iconic landmarks such as the Statue of Liberty and the Empire State Building.
15) Amid this utter destruction, Emily, Jack, and a collective of some of the finest minds from around the globe gather at Cambridge University, putting forth a bold plan to counteract the unfolding catastrophe.
16) Pooling their knowledge, they concoct a potentially game-changing serum aimed at reversing the abnormal growth patterns, theoretically resizing the creatures to their original harmless state.
17) Courageously, they decide to administer their newly engineered serum as an attempt to reclaim their besieged world.
18) Braving unforeseeable dangers, this brave cadre of scientists delve into the ominous, labyrinthine lairs of these monstrous beasts.
19) Imploring unyielding courage in the face of deathly peril, these valiant men and women administer the miracle serum to the leviathan creatures.
20) To their indescribable relief, the once fearsome behemoths gradually shrink down to a harmless size, complying with their desperate pleas for mercy.
21) As the city-shaking roars of the beasts gradually subside to mere squeaks, and the colossal devastation halts, the battered beings under its reign perceive a glimmer of hope.
22) However, their moment of victory is abruptly truncated by the surfacing of a new terror — a Godzilla-sized monstrosity that is deemed king among the giant reptiles.
23) Even as this new challenge looms ahead, Emily and Jack, the unshaken defenders of humankind, rally global forces to stand their ground and continue battling the immense creature.
24) Seizing courage from the jaws of fear, Emily enters the danger zone — directly into the path of the gigantic creature — to take a shot at administering the final dose of the shrinking serum.
25) As the serum takes effect, her heroic act causes inadvertent disturbance among the meteor debris peacefully orbiting in the Earth's outer space.
26) This disturbance turns lethal as it triggers a chain reaction sending an even more massive meteor, double the size of its predecessor, spiraling towards earth at an alarming speed.
27) Earth's inhabitants once again find themselves engulfed in terror.
28) Understanding the gravity of the situation, Emily hastily devises a counter strategy using cutting-edge laser technology to pulverize the incoming meteor.
29) Emily, under the hopeful gaze of the entire human race, fires a colossal laser from Earth's newly developed defense cannon built by SpaceX.
30) The laser strikes true; reducing the monstrous rock into beautiful yet harmless fragments that burn like a cosmic firework in the night sky.
31) As the meteor fragments fall harmlessly into the sea, the world heaves a sigh of relief.
32) Emily, Jack, and their team become overnight heroes, celebrated in every nook and corner for their indomitable bravery.
33) From the sandstone depths of America's Grand Canyon to the sacred and intricate temples of Kyoto in Japan, the world gradually regains its lost vitality.
34) Across the planet, signals of a hopeful tomorrow emerge.
35) Emily and Jack become the global symbols of courage and hope.
36) As the debris of the devastated past is cleared and new foundations are laid, a spirit of unfettered optimism takes hold.
37) However, just when the world is reveling in their newfound victory, an ominous specter emerges from the shadows — a surviving colossal reptile, previously unnoticed.
38) As a leviathan silhouette ominously lurks on the outskirts of a joyful Paris, the jubilant survivors remain oblivious.
39) Did their efforts bring only temporary respite or did they manage to establish a permanent solution?
40) Leaving their imprint, the filmmakers hint at future conflicts with potential reptilian threats, driving anticipation for sequel.
41) However, humanity rests easy knowing that in Emily and Jack, they have dedicated defenders always ready to brace against the next possible onslaught.
42) As the screen edges towards darkness, we're offered a final chilling glimpse of a monstrous silhouette, teasing unimaginable dangers ahead.

### TASK

1. **Identify the protagonist in the story**: The story has two main characters, Emily and Jack, who work together to save humanity. For the purpose of analyzing the story arc, we can consider them collectively as the protagonist or focus on Emily, as the story starts with her and she plays a crucial role throughout.

2. **First turning point (tp1) - Opportunity**: Sentence 2 - "On a particular bone-chilling winter night, her ultra-sensitive computer systems power on unexpectedly, revealing a worrisome interstellar image of an enormous meteor, roughly half the size of the moon, charging towards Earth at a fearsome velocity." 
   - At this point, Emily's state changes from a position of professional stability and success to one of alarm and responsibility, as she discovers the meteor threatening Earth. 3. **Second turning point (tp2) - Change of Plans**: Sentence 6 - "In a massive burst of cosmic energy, the colossal meteorite plunges towards Earth, showering bizarre emerald-tinted debris, significantly affecting the African continental expanse."
   - This event marks a significant change in the story as the meteor's impact introduces a new, unpredictable element (the mutations) that directly affects humanity's survival. Relative to the first turning point, the situation has become more dire and unpredictable. Emily's (and humanity's) condition has worsened; we can approximate it as a 2, indicating a severe crisis with unknown consequences.

4. **Third turning point (tp3) - Point of No Return**: Sentence 11 - "Recognizing the urgent need for cooperative action despite their diverse fields of study, Emily, the esteemed astronomer, and Jack, the revered biologist, join forces to curtail the gargantuan threat to humanity."
   - At this point, Emily and Jack commit to working together to address the crisis, marking a point of no return in their efforts to save humanity. We can approximate their condition as a 4, indicating a glimmer of hope in a very challenging situation.

5. **Fourth turning point (tp4) - Major Setback**: Sentence 25 - "As the serum takes effect, her heroic act causes inadvertent disturbance among the meteor debris peacefully orbiting in the Earth's outer space."
   - This event introduces a new and significant setback, as the action taken to solve one problem (the giant reptiles) inadvertently creates another (a larger meteor heading towards Earth). Relative to the third turning point, the situation has become more critical again. We can approximate their condition as a 1, indicating a severe and potentially insurmountable challenge.

6. **Fifth turning point (tp5) - Climax**: Sentence 29 - "Emily, under the hopeful gaze of the entire human race, fires a colossal laser from Earth's newly developed defense cannon built by SpaceX."
   - This marks the climax of the story, where Emily takes a decisive action to save humanity from the second meteor. Compared to the fourth turning point, this action leads to a resolution of the main conflict, significantly improving Emily's (and humanity's) condition. We can approximate it as a 10, indicating a successful resolution to the crisis and a return to safety.

7. **Protagonist's condition list**: Based on the analysis, the list of numbers representing the protagonist's condition at each turning point is [6, 2, 4, 1, 10].

8. **Classify the story arc type**: The story arc type can be classified based on the pattern of the protagonist's condition. Starting at a 6, dropping to a 2, slightly recovering to a 4, then facing a significant setback to a 1, and finally resolving the conflict and improving to a 10. This pattern shows a protagonist facing challenges, recovering, facing an even greater challenge, and then ultimately succeeding. This resembles the **Double Man in a Hole** story arc, where the protagonist faces two cycles of dilemma and recovery, ending in a better state than at the beginning.

9. **Determined story arc type**: Double Man in a Hole

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Far away from the instantaneous rhythms of sprawling urban settlements, the quiet mining town of Gibson existed, embraced in a predictable, almost quaint routine.
2) This routine was rudely shattered one evening, as the town was raided by the dread-inspiring Red Coyotes, a lawless gang notorious for its ruthless exploits.
3) Running amok and chuckling grimly at the disturbing tranquillity, they desecrated the mansion of Samuel Hartley, Gibson's most affluent and respected gold miner.
4) Sheriff Evan Dobbs had the unenviable task of restoring balance amidst the mounting unrest in the shell-shocked, mining town.
5) Despite the panic that began creeping through Gibson, Evan's grit remained untouched, becoming the beacon that held the terrified townsfolk together.
6) Embarking on the puzzling case of the audacious robbery at Hartley's mansion, Evan unearthed a shocking revelation.
7) Hartley, the respected pillar of Gibson, was involved in illegal gold trafficking in connivance with the disruptive gang.
8) This unfortunate discovery spread amongst the townsfolk like wildfire, triggering a wave of resentment and suspicion towards Hartley, one of their own.
9) While this was unravelling, the Red Coyotes continued to terrorize Gibson, orchestrating nocturnal raids that amplified the town's already building apprehension.
10) With every passing day of enduring these unlawful intrusions, the people of Gibson looked at Evan with disconcertingly increasing uncertainty.
11) As tension mounted, the narrative twisted brutally, revealing Evan's tormented past with an outlawed gang.
12) This presented a spine-chilling paradox: Gibson’s honest Sheriff was a man with a past mired in criminal activities.
13) Adding another layer to the puzzle was an old, faded photograph discovered in the secret drawer of Evan's desk, portraying an enchanting woman named Lily.
14) The plot thickened ominously as it was uncovered that Lily, a vestige of Evan's past and lost love, existed within the community of Gibson.
15) Evan, in a daring move, rallied the perturbed folks to prepare an offensive against the Red Coyotes.
16) Their collective doubt started to abate, giving way to an unwilling endorsement of Evan’s daring operation.
17) Tragedy struck as the painstakingly crafted plan unraveled unexpectedly.
18) A rogue Coyote kidnapped Lily, leaving Evan grappling with a nightmarish personal crisis.
19) Torn between his deep-seated feelings for Lily and his unwavering duty to the town of Gibson, Evan found himself embroiled in a heart-wrenching conflict.
20) In an electrifying gamble, he revealed his tainted side from his past life in order to single-handedly confront the Coyotes.
21) A gripping showdown ensued, pitting Evan against the menacing gang leader Jack.
22) Witnessing Evan's audacious bravery, the petrified residents of Gibson rallied, united in their newfound support for him.
23) Lily, displaying her quick-witted ingenuity, plotted a bold escape from her captors.
24) Evan's revolvers pierced the Coyotes, symbolising an altercation against his troubled past.
25) The formidable gang leader, Jack, found himself bested by Evan's unwavering resolve, ending the Red Coyotes' reign of terror.
26) The residents watched their immediate fears dissolve, replaced by a galvanising resurgence of hope.
27) With peace restored, the townsfolk set about rebuilding their once tranquil lives and their beloved, besieged town.
28) Gibson regained its vitality, its victory symbolising the unyielding spirit of its people.
29) Evan found himself reminiscing his own metamorphosis from a feared outlaw to a respected protector.
30) The tale reached its resolution, with Evan acknowledging the stains of his past, standing firm in his role as the sentinel of Gibson, embracing his checkered past as testament to his resolve to protect his town.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 2.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 7.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 20.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 21.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 25.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

6) He indulges in a royal feast, gorging on culinary delights, gallivanting with jovial courtiers, blinded by the opulence at play.
7) His path intersects with that of Seriphia, a notorious Dryad spoken of in hushed whispers around the outskirts.
8) Drunk on his royal blood, Alfred recklessly bellows, ordering Seriphia to kneel before his noble lineage.
9) A gross display of arrogance, he becomes unknowingly responsible for triggering her wrath.
10) Seriphia's reply resonates in an echoing laughter, defying royal command.
11) This clash of status sparks a hostile clash, casting a heavy shroud of dread over the cheerful murals of Nordhelm.
12) Seriphia, in a cruel twist, turns to drain Alfred of his pride-induced energy.

20) Stoked by an overwhelming resolve to protect Nordhelm, the duo confronts Seriphia, triggering a final showdown that ripples the very essence of the kingdom.

24) But not before leaving Eldric with a grievous wound.
25) Eldric uses his waning breath to entrust the protection of Nordhelm to Alfred.
26) Alfred attempts to reconcile with Eldric's sacrificial death.
27) He pledges to shield Nordhelm from inevitable threats, honoring the memory of the brave hunter.
28) Alfred ushers an era of tranquility in Nordhelm.
29) A peaceful beginning signifying the dawn of a revitalized realm in his command.
30) A haunting howl slices through the serene night, spelling out the advent of a nerve-wracking chapter in the saga.
31) Standing atop the castle's highest tower, Alfred's shadowy presence forms a daunting silhouette against the moon.
32) A resounding royal decree reverberates across the dimly lit alleys of Nordhelm, rallying the kingdom folk to prepare for an impending assault.

### 1. Identify the protagonist in the story
The protagonist in this story is Alfred, the prince of Moonstone Nordhelm. Although Eldric plays a significant role, the story's progression and character development suggest that Alfred is the central figure whose transformation and growth are key to the narrative.

### 2. At the sentence indicated by the first turning point, state the sentence again, and describe the protagonist's state.
The first turning point is at sentence 8.0: "Drunk on his royal blood, Alfred recklessly bellows, ordering Seriphia to kneel before his noble lineage." At this point, Alfred is in a state of arrogance and ignorance of the consequences of his actions, which can be considered a relatively high point in terms of his confidence but a low point in terms of wisdom and humility. His condition can be approximated as a 6, considering he is acting out of pride but is about to trigger a significant downfall.

### 3. Identify the second turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the first turning point.
The second turning point is at sentence 14.0: "On seeing the Dryad raise her arm to deliver a lethal blow, Eldric selflessly intervenes, launching his celestial Moonsteel blade against her." Relative to the first turning point, Alfred's state has significantly deteriorated. He has been drained of his pride-induced energy by Seriphia and is now in a state of physical and mental exhaustion. This can be approximated as a 2, indicating a severe decline from his previous state of arrogance and confidence.

### 4. Identify the third turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the second turning point.
The third turning point is at sentence 18.0: "Their combined forces successfully deter the minor beings lurking on the outskirts of Elderwood, inching closer every day towards Seriphia's wood-knotted abode." Here, Alfred has begun to recover and grow. He has formed an alliance with Eldric and undergone rigorous combat training, becoming more adept and confident in his abilities to face the threats to Nordhelm. This improvement can be approximated as a 4, showing a significant recovery from his previous low point.

### 5. Identify the fourth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the third turning point.
The fourth turning point is at sentence 20.0: "Stoked by an overwhelming resolve to protect Nordhelm, the duo confronts Seriphia, triggering a final showdown that ripples the very essence of the kingdom." At this point, Alfred and Eldric are ready to face Seriphia, indicating a peak in their preparation and resolve. However, this also marks a point of significant risk and potential downfall. Alfred's condition can be approximated as a 7, reflecting his growth, determination, and the high stakes of the confrontation ahead.

### 6. Identify the fifth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the fourth turning point.
The fifth turning point is at sentence 25.0: "Eldric uses his waning breath to entrust the protection of Nordhelm to Alfred." This event occurs after Eldric's grievous wound from battling Seriphia, marking a significant loss for Alfred. Despite this, Alfred has been entrusted with the responsibility of protecting Nordhelm, symbolizing his growth into a capable leader. However, the immediate context of losing Eldric and the weight of new responsibility could initially be seen as a setback. Considering the story's progression and Alfred's newfound role, his condition can be approximated as an 8, acknowledging his sadness and the challenge ahead but also his readiness to lead and protect Nordhelm.

### 7. List the protagonist's condition at each turning point.
Based on the descriptions, the list of Alfred's condition at each turning point is: 6, 2, 4, 7, 8.

### 8. Classify the story arc type based on the protagonist's condition list and explain your reasoning.
The story arc type can be classified as "Double Man in a Hole" or more closely aligned with the "Cinderella" arc, given the specific patterns observed. Initially, Alfred falls into a dilemma (from 6 to 2), then recovers and grows (to 4), faces another challenge (peaking at 7 before the final confrontation), and ultimately achieves a higher state (ending at 8) despite experiencing a significant setback (Eldric's death). This pattern resembles the "Cinderella" arc more closely than "Double Man in a Hole" because it involves a rise, a fall, and then a final rise to an even higher point, rather than two complete cycles of fall and recovery.

### 9. Determine the story arc type.
Cinderella.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) After rescuing Toki from the Revengeancers and defeating the Metal Masked Assassin, Dethklok hold a press conference to announce a new tour and music.
2) While the rest of the band have no recollection of the actual rescue, Nathan is suffering from post-traumatic stress from the experience and Magnus Hammersmith's suicide, while Toki has emotionally regressed to a child-like state as a coping mechanism.
3) This results in him passing out during their first performance back together and all plans being indefinitely paused while he recovers at Mordhaus.
4) During a memorial service for Ishnifus Meaddle, Charles Offdensen (now leader of the Church of the Black Klok) tasks Nathan with writing the "Song of Salvation" to prevent the Doomstar from destroying the Earth and allowing Mr Salacia to become whole again, but Nathan declines, choosing to settle down with Abigail.
5) However, Abigail declines his proposal.
6) After a confrontation with fans who witnessed it, Nathan ultimately decides to focus on his music, and the band head to a secret location under the guidance of Dick Knubbler.
7) Meanwhile, General Crozier has been temporarily freed from control by Mr Salacia while he attempts to possess another, as he can only possess one person at a time.
8) Now aware of what the Tribunal's true motives are, Crozier attempts to get a message out, but is stopped by Vater Orlaag before Salacia regains control.
9) It turns out that the other person Salacia is attempting to possess is William Murderface, who experiences disturbing and painful hallucinations as Salacia takes control and influences him to damage Nathan's confidence and prevent the Song of Salvation from being written, as well as revealing the location of the Army of the Doomstar.
10) At the end of their training and a drug induced meeting between Nathan and the Whale Prophet, the band begin performing the Song of Salvation.
11) However, as they begin, Nathan realises that this is the wrong song.
12) During their performance of "Aortic Desecration", the Doomstar approaches Earth and begins the Metalocalypse, destroying monuments across the planet and killing millions.
13) The US Army and the Tribunal's own militia then attack the band's location, wiping out the Army of the Doomstar and killing Knubbler.
14) During the attack, Crozier is able to free himself of Salacia's control for good while Murderface flees, still possessed and blaming himself for sabotaging the band's attempt to save the world.
15) Crozier offers his help to the band as Skwisgaar, still in shock from the attack, is able to reveal Murderface's possession to the others.
16) Crozier tells the band how to free him from Salacia and the band forgive him for what happened, given that he was not in control of his actions, explaining that he belongs in the band as he brings balance to the group with his negativity.
17) Realising what they now need to do, Dethklok and Crozier reconvene with Edgar Jomfru to perform the correct Song of Salvation, "SOS", but during their performance, Vater Orlaag orders an attack on the group.
18) Dethklok are captured by Salacia and, after Nathan refuses Salacia's offer to join him, the five are hooked up to the supercomputer Salacia built to draw in the Doomstar.
19) This allows Salacia to draw on the power of the Doomstar and commence the "Great Reuniting", becoming whole once more, but Nathan is able to break free of his restraints and break the computer long enough for the rest of the band to break free.
20) Jomfru and Crozier infiltrate the facility, with Jomfru planting a bomb to destroy the supercomputer while Crozier attempts to regain control of the US military.
21) Jomfru is killed, but not before successfully activating the bomb.
22) The band are joined by Offdensen, the Church of the Black Klok, and their legions of fans, and fight the Tribunal's forces and the US Army while Vater Orlaag fights Offdensen.
23) Just as Orlaag is about to kill Offdensen, he is distracted by Murderface, allowing Offdensen to recover and kill Orlaag.
24) Crozier manages to regain control of the US military and orders them to stand down and assist the fans, apprehending the Tribunal's forces.
25) However, Salacia emerges from his coccoon in his true form, killing many of the people on the battlefield.
26) As he attempts to kill Dethklok, Nathan draws on the power of the Doomstar himself to counter Salacia's attacks.
27) The band's power spreads to the legions of fans, amplifying their power and forcing Salacia to "Go into the Water", where he is finally killed by the Whale Prophet.
28) Addressing their fans in the aftermath, Nathan realises that the fans are the true Army of the Doomstar, and that their new relationship with their fans is the true "Great Reuniting".
29) The group and fans celebrate as the movie ends.

- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

- Opportunity (tp1): 3.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 6.5 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 16.5 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 25.5 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 27.5 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

instruction: Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Robert Freeman, a renowned New York attorney renowned for his relentless pursuit of justice, engaged in fierce battles within the courtroom whilst representing clients in intricate murder trials, became a familiar figure in the city's legal community.
2) High above the city streets in his palatial seventh-floor corner office, with sweeping views of the Manhattan skyline, Robert found himself lost in the world of litigation, each brick and steel edifice blotting out the memories of his quaint suburban home and his inquisitive 8-year-old son, Tyler.
3) During his father's long hours at the office, Tyler, left mostly to his own devices, enjoyed pouring over enchanting tales of Greek mythology.
4) Encased in the labyrinthine stories, he found a passion in the unraveling of symbolic riddles and transposing his interpretations onto the worn pages of his sketchpad.
5) One afternoon, snatched from the clutches of legal precedents by the startling vibration of his smartphone, Robert looked down to see an unrecognizable number flashing on the screen.
6) Listening to the gravelly voice on the other end, Robert felt a chill of dread as the voice directed him to the Serenity Playground.
7) The fond memories of Tyler's excitable laughter faded, replaced by the harsh reality that the playground was now shrouded in the ink-black darkness of the night.
8) Rushing through the gates, the eerie silence and insomnia of the moonlight heightened the surreal and terrifying reality.
9) Robert’s horror-stricken eyes fell upon the stark emptiness; Tyler’s beloved sketchpad lay abandoned on a bench, a worn-out graphite pencil beside it.
10) The sight struck him as a brutal reminder of the widening gulf between his career and his role as a father.
11) His heart pounded with an unbearable terror: Tyler had vanished without a trace.
12) In response to Tyler’s inexplicable disappearance, the NYPD initiated a rigorous investigation; however, the lack of witnesses or any substantial evidence hindered their progress.
13) They were stumped by the absence of a lead.
14) Racked with guilt and desperation, Robert decided to utilize his keen attention to detail, harnessed over his years as an attorney, in the search for his son.
15) Starting in Tyler's room, he painstakingly sifted through the whimsical mess of dinosaur figurines and poster-filled walls that epitomized Tyler's spirit.
16) Amidst the frustration and hopelessness, Robert noticed a crumpled piece of paper in the corner.
17) Unfolding the paper, he discovered a cryptic note penned by Tyler, revealing a coded message based on their shared love of Greek myths.
18) Deciphering the mysterious note led Robert to a dilapidated tenement, swathed in shadows, in the heart of Brooklyn - a place in stark contrast to his air-conditioned, high-rise office.
19) The grim building was home to an eccentric old man, whispered to possess an encyclopedic knowledge of Greek mythology.
20) Arrogance and fear set aside, Robert sought his help.
21) The old man scrutinized the coded message, revealing its fascinating connection to the twelve daunting tasks of Hercules - his legendary labors.
22) Though skeptical and wary of the modern world's intrusions.
23) the man was intrigued by the unusual case and agreed to lend his expertise to the desperate father, initiating an unexpected alliance.
24) All the while, Mia, a striking woman with a mysterious past, whose fingerprints had been discovered at the playground, resurfaced from the shadows.
25) Tormented by guilt and her link to the case, Mia came forward.
26) She’d been the last person to see Tyler at the playground that day and felt a compelling responsibility to help in whatever way she could.
27) Driven by remorse and empathy, Mia allied herself with Robert, enhancing their combined knowledge with her recall of the events at the playground and any potential clues she might have unintentionally possessed.
28) Encountering a series of unexpected threats and engaging in chilling pursuits, the unlikely trio found themselves face to face with a dangerous criminal organization that shared a peculiar connection with Hercules's myth.
29) During a high-risk escape from the hair-raising dangers, Robert stumbled upon a hidden laptop in Tyler's secret treehouse.
30) The laptop revealed a chilling video clip of Tyler's abduction, causing his heart to stutter with fear and urgency.
31) In the gut-wrenching footage, the terrifying face of a masked man pressuring Tyler for information about Hercules’s ninth labor - the Belt of Hippolyta - became clearly visible.
32) The horrifying reality added a sense of dire urgency to their ongoing quest.
33) Mia and the old man joined forces with Robert to dissect the complex maze of Greek legends, leading them toward the legendary sanctuary of the belt.
34) Their relentless pursuit for clues reached a dramatic climax where they found themselves engaged in a brutal confrontation with the kidnapper’s ruthless henchmen.
35) Lured by the immeasurable power of the belt, they defended their unholy mission vehemently.
36) Leveraging his well-honed strategic thinking and unwavering determination, Robert led a heroic confrontation against the relentless villains.
37) As Robert held the antagonists at bay, Mia and the mythology savant successfully located a hidden basement where Tyler had been cruelly confined, ensnared within crude, iron bars.
38) With Tyler finally safe, the courageous duo made a swift exit, their flight aided by the sudden appearance of NYPD squad cars against the backdrop of the night, their sirens cutting through the ghostly silence.
39) Amidst New York's labyrinthine streets, Robert held his traumatized son close, promising himself to make amends for past mistakes and striving to rebuild their damaged relationship.
40) Gripping his phone, he dialed Linda's number, his estranged wife.
41) When she answered, Robert was able to share the most significant news: Tyler was safe.
42) Faced with the harsh reality and glaring shortcomings as a father, Robert made a momentous decision to turn his back on his thriving legal profession.
43) Robert hung up his crisp business suits, replacing them with everyday wear, and prioritized being a caring, attentive father.
44) His focus now solely on restoring Tyler’s innocence and helping him heal from the traumatic incident.
45) Together, they journeyed through therapy sessions, as they learned to navigate the turbulent emotional sea of their shared experiences, fostering a renewed bond founded on understanding, empathy, and unspoken love.
46) "My Boy's Disappearance" closes with Robert, deep into the night, softly narrating tales of Hercules’ valor to Tyler.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In 1954 Detroit, Michigan, gangster Curt Goynes, in need of cash to leave town, is recruited to threaten a family as part of a blackmail scheme, along with gangsters Ronald Russo and Charley.
2) The recruiter, Doug Jones, sends them to the house of GM accountant Matt Wertz, where they are to hold the family hostage while sending Wertz to the office where he works, to retrieve a document from his boss's safe.
3) Finding it empty, a desperate Wertz brings fake documents to Jones, then returns home, where Charley prepares to execute the entire family, to the surprise of Goynes and Russo.
4) Not wanting to be part of a massacre, Goynes shoots and kills Charley.
5) Jones phones the house, having discovered the documents are fake.
6) He orders Goynes to kill Russo and the family, and Goynes realizes he and Russo have been set up.
7) Before they leave, Goynes instructs the family to tell the police that Charley broke into their home and that Wertz killed Charley in self-defense.
8) The police detective, Joe Finney, is skeptical of the family's story.
9) Once the police leave, Goynes, Russo, and Wertz go to Wertz's boss's house in Ohio and retrieve the real document, which turns out to be plans for a new car part.
10) Goynes and Russo discover they have a high bounty placed on their heads, and make plans to ascertain what the document is worth by arranging a meeting with Frank Capelli, the man whose wife Russo is having an affair with, and who is the mob leader who contracted the blackmail scheme.
11) Meanwhile, Goynes makes further arrangements with mob leader Aldrick Watkins, with whom he has been on the outs, to clear himself by giving Watkins part of the eventual payment.
12) Goynes and Russo have a meeting with Capelli.
13) Goynes deduces that the value of the document vastly exceeds the amount they considered it was worth.
14) Jones arrives and points a gun, showing that he and Capelli have been planning to turn on Goynes and Russo.
15) In the resulting shootout, Jones is killed.
16) Capelli flees, only to be caught by Goynes and Russo, who extract the name of his contact: Naismith, a Studebaker executive.
17) Goynes calls Naismith and arranges to sell him the document for $125,000.
18) Capelli escapes, but when he returns home, his battered wife Vanessa shoots and kills him, and then departs with a suitcase full of cash.
19) Seeking a bigger payday, Goynes and Russo return to Wertz's boss's home and make him call his contact further up the chain of command, arrogant automobile manufacturer's association executive Mike Lowen.
20) Goynes and Russo meet with Lowen at a downtown hotel, where he pays them $375,000 to return the document.
21) It is revealed to be plans for a catalytic converter.
22) Lowen is seeking to conceal its existence from the public to avoid government pressure on the car companies to implement pollution controls.
23) After Lowen leaves, Goynes and Russo split the money but are interrupted by Goynes' associate, mob leader Watkins, and his men, who have already retrieved the $125,000 from Naismith.
24) It initially seems that Goynes and Watkins may have teamed up to betray Russo, but Watkins' men lead Goynes away at gunpoint.
25) Russo is allowed to leave with the $375,000.
26) As Watkins and his men leave the hotel, they're stopped by Detective Finney and his policemen; Watkins bribes the detective with $50,000 of the Naismith money to let them leave with Goynes, saying that Goynes will be "taken care of."
27) Russo flees the city with Vanessa, but when they leave the main road to avoid an apparent pursuer, she kills Russo and claims the money for herself.
28) She is soon pulled over by a policeman, who takes the $375,000 as well as her 31,000 and then allows her to leave.
29) Detective Finney, having retrieved the $406,000 from the cop, privately returns it to Lowen, along with the $50,000 bribe from Watkins.
30) Watkins takes Goynes to a pier, but rather than "take care" of him, he makes amends with him.
31) He offers Goynes a share of the remaining Naismith money, but Goynes wants only the $5,000 he originally contracted for, and is allowed to leave for Kansas City.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) A most terrifying revelation from Ben's past unexpectedly resurfaces, haunting him at every turn.
2) This revolves around his beloved infant daughter, Evie.
3) A seemingly ordinary child at birth, she was discovered to harbor pyrokinetic powers, a shocking truth revealed when she inadvertently set her bamboo crib ablaze at the tender age of two, an accident that culminated in the tragic demise of her mother, Amelia.
4) In the aftermath of this tragic event, a time jump takes us to present day, landing us into the life of the now 16-year-old Evie.
5) She was forced into solitude as her father, Ben, lived in constant fear of the recurrence of a tragedy due to his daughter's uncontrollable, fire-starting abilities.
6) Hoping to provide a semblance of normality for his isolated daughter, Ben appoints Ms. Janet, a former school teacher, for home education.
7) He harbors hope in his heart that this semblance of routine would help Evie in controlling her powers better.
8) But all hopes are dashed one petrifying evening when Evie loses control.
9) Her powers erupt with startling intensity, resulting in a spine-chilling accident which claims the life Ms. Janet and leaves their quaint, blue-painted house severely damaged.
10) Stricken with panic and guilt, Ben turns to Esther, a reserved elderly woman rumoured to be knowledgeable regarding unnatural phenomena.
11) His hope is that she may offer some guidance to manage Evie's extraordinary abilities.
12) To Ben's horror, Esther unravels a prophecy, forecasting Evie's powers to ascend in a destructive manner, leaving nothing but ruin in their path.
13) Ben is left to grapple with the terrifying knowledge of what his daughter's powers could eventually lead to.
14) Overcome with fear and dread, Ben makes the drastic decision of confining Evie to the dark, damp cellar below their century-old house.
15) He does this against his own will, wishing to protect both his daughter and the vicinity from her destructive powers.
16) Instead of mitigating the problem, the confinement appears to fuel Evie's powers even further, leading to terrifying nightmares and a deepening sense of unrest and harm, further escalating her already distressed state.
17) The unlikely character, Sarah, a perceptive neighbor with distinctive, curly auburn hair, stumbles upon the strange happenings of the house and is eventually drawn towards the confined, anxiety-ridden teenager, Evie.
18) As Sarah becomes more attuned to Evie's distress, she manages to provide a glimmer of hope and comfort for the confined teenager, reaching out to her with understanding and kindness.
19) Fully aware of Evie's condition and its complexity, Sarah suggests reaching out to a specialist in this field, only to be met with Ben's straightforward rejection.
20) Defying Ben's wishes, Sarah continues her pursuit of help, leading her to the renowned Detective Graham, a psychiatrist known for handling exceptional paranormal cases.
21) Under the veil of secrecy, Graham enters Evie's life.
22) Astounded initially by the scale of Evie's powers, Graham gradually adapts to her unique circumstances, shedding light on the potential approach to handling her abilities.
23) Their clandestine meetings aimed at providing Evie with crucial help are unwittingly exposed to Ben leading to an upheaval.
24) An explosive confrontation ensues between Ben and Sarah, triggering a surge of pyrokinetic energy from Evie, engulfing their house in an uncontrollable inferno, critically injuring Sarah in the process.
25) Amidst the chaos ensured by her own powers, Evie struggles with guilt.
26) However, the feeling pushes her to harness her abilities under the tutelage of Detective Graham.
27) Displaying an unprecedented degree of control, she suppresses the blazing fire threatening to consume her loved ones.
28) This astonishing feat rescues both Sarah and Ben from impending doom.
29) Witnessing Evie’s invincible determination to overpower her destructive nature and protect those she cares for, softens Ben’s heart and forces him to reconsider his approach towards his daughter’s powers.
30) Ben realizes that confinement isn’t the solution but providing an environment that nurtures her abilities is.
31) He, therefore, sets out on a path to establish a more conducive environment for her powers while also trying to make her everyday life less threatening.
32) The tale unfolds thrillingly, concluding in a suspense-filled cliffhanger upon the utterance of 'Phoenix Rising', an enigmatic organization dealing with extraordinary individuals, foreshadowing a riveting sequel awaiting further exploration of Evie's unprecedented potential.

1) Isabel, a fiercely independent and rebellious 16-year-old, navigates her first day at Leafmore High School in the secluded and painfully sleepy town of Paynes Corner, Wastingshire.
2) She is the daughter of the stern Walter, Wastingshire's diligent and unyielding sheriff.
3) Isabel and Walter’s tumultuous relationship is marred by continual tension.
4) Mason Stratton, often identified as the local bully, makes his presence felt through his terrifying antics, spreading an air of palpable fear among the town's residents.
5) Fired up by a potent mix of frustration and unwavering courage, Isabel decides to take a stand against Mason Stratton's reign of terror.
6) Under the hush of a moonlit night, Isabel shakes up the peaceful atmosphere of the town by audaciously slashing the tires of Mason Stratton's prized pickup truck.
7) As the break of dawn reveals his vandalised truck, Mason’s simmering rage explodes.
8) His relentless pursuit unexpectedly reveals that the offender is Isabel, the sherrif's daughter.
9) News of Isabel's courageous act filters through the narrow hallways of Leafmore High, sparking an uprising against Mason Stratton's tyrannical rule among her fellow students.
10) As a response, Mason begins to drop ominous threats at Isabel's doorstep.
11) Walter, finding himself torn between maintaining law and order in Paynes Corner and assuring his daughter's safety, steps up to unveil the perpetrator behind the ongoing threats.
12) With repeated threats, Isabel and her newfound allies devise a bold plan to bring down Mason's regime, once and for all.
13) Their plan involves infiltrating Stratton's Garage, Mason's infamous auto repair shop.
14) As the plan shapes up, Walter unravels Mason's nexus with several illegal operations.
15) The climax comes to life as Isabel and her team flawlessly execute their daring plan, damaging essential parts of Mason's truck and pulling off a breath-taking narrow escape.
16) Their actions incite a high-stakes chase, with Mason pursuing the group through Paynes Corner's antiquated, lamp-lit lanes.
17) Isabel and her team are cornered in a secluded alleyway.
18) As tension mounts and Mason approaches threateningly, Walter steps out from the dim alley holding up his Colt Python .357 magnum.
19) With the evidence against Stratton compiled meticulously, Walter manages to unveil Mason's criminal alliances, leading to his immediate arrest.
20) Isabel’s brave actions not only instil a sense of justice among the oppressed locals but also resolves the heated tension with her father.
21) Isabel organises a non-violent march as a preventive measure against any potential miscarriage of justice in Paynes Corner.
22) As the dust of the past settles down, the final scene showcases Isabel fearlessly strolling past a menacing Ford truck near her high school, a reflection of her transformation from a reckless teen to an authoritative figure in Paynes Corner.
